review: we visited in january for business and some R&R. From  arrival to leaving we were treated like royalty. Personalized welcome and treated like Royalty. The asst. mgr. jayne was amazing in making sure all our needs were attended to during our stay. We even extended by a day as the atmosphere was so relaxing, well cleaned and modern rooms, excellent food and friendly staff. The tulia spa is an excellent place for relaxing. Fridah one fo the spa staff is really good at her job. This is now my home away from home when at the coast.
title: January business meeting

review: The view of the rooms is very nice. Rooms are clean and beautiful. Breakfast buffet was complete. Hotel's restaurants for dinner and lunch was very expensive. Staffs were hospitable and kind. Corona protocols were considered in this hotel.
title: A beautiful hotel

review: So as a frequent visitor to Sarova Whitesands at least a minimum of 3 times in a year I have never actually written a review. I think now is a good time. Firstly big thanks to my agent Zeno Safaris who always know how to ensure things are booked the way I like. Bigger thanks to the team at Sarova reservations who make it happen. With covid and all tourism has been hit and Whitesands being one of the biggest beach hotels in Mombasa they are truly doing all they can to keep up business as normal. That's a big achievement and kudos to the management of the hotel. Check-in to most Sarova Hotels is always warm and caring. Thats one of the hotels key pillars.  With covid the check in was fast and quick. Rooms are great. Get the pool facing ones if you can. All recently renovated in
title: Top Quality

review: Amazing staff, clean rooms, good food and best of all the pools. Friendly and helpful staff. Considering it was a work/rest break the hotel did very well for both scenarios. The conference rooms very good as well.
title: Amazing with superb service

review: Whitesands was simply divine. The rooms were comfy, clean and well maintained. We really enjoyed swimming in multiple pools. The food was delicious. The staff was amazing, Francis by the pool was very kind. So were Brian, Anthony and Levina.
title: Exceeded expectations

review: I stayed in the white sand for one week and it was fun all the way. The food variety is fantastic,  the waiters are very smart and friendly. The bars are wonderful and the drink mixtures is what one need to have a very good night rest.
title: The large but compent hotel

review: I like pride inn Mombasa because of its location and services. I would recommend it for those travelling on business. Though they dont have a swimming pool and gynmm facilities, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, they offer great breakfast and very good customer service.
title: Ms

review: Brilliant resort with clean comfortable rooms, great food and friendly helpful staff.  Particular mention goes to Michael in Cocos Beach bar, Susan in Minazi cafe and Jamis our pool attendant all of whom went above and beyond to make our stay extra special.
title: Excellent resort

review: Great hotel with excellent service and excellent food. Our friend Francis pool man deserves great praise, he helped us a lot.All inclusive in this hotel is of a very high standard. Absolutely an object worth recommending
title: Great hotel

review: We stayed at the resort for four nights with our children and everyone had a fantastic time. Everyone from the check in staff, catering and gardening were friendly and helpful. The kids spent some time with the ozone teenage group and the carers were brilliant with them. We found the choice of food to be extensive and well prepared. The evening entertainment was varied but we especially liked the acrobatic act. We will be back.
title: Brilliant family resort

review: I enjoyed my stay though it was just for the night.  It is a huge property but does not look that big from the onset.  The food was good and the service was equally good.  Looking forward to staying there again.
title: Escape

review: Check in doesn't take 3 hours. And the response shouldn't be the hotel is full. Trash check in trash service trash all around. The food is oily and made us sick on day 1. Then they make you sign a waiver so you can't accuse them rightfully so of poisoning you. Trash hotel. Go to serena
title: Nonsense

review: Beautiful landscape gardens and pools. Very comfortable room and bed. The staff was very helpful and friendly and large variety of delicious food. I would recommend to pay a little extra and get the sea view room
title: Beautiful resort

review: I was celebrating my birthday and the manager and the staff were amazing I was given 5 star treatment. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I enjoyed a treatment in the spa with Fridah she was excellent.
title: Celebrating with my friends

review: We stayed in three Sarova properties on our recent trip to Kenya. The first two (Mara Game Camp and Lion Hill) were very good. White Sands was flat-out terrible. There is no question that it is a beautiful property, but I can't think of anything else about the place that worked as well as a typical 2-Star resort. The check-in process was horrible. After first informing us that we had no reservation, they then admitted that they gave our room away to someone who extended their stay. What's worse is that they did not have replacement room ready until 3:30 PM! Service at the Lido Bar is non-existent. Our in-room safe did not work and they were in no rush to fix it. There were no robes in our room. There was only one chair on our balcony. Our waiter admitted that they rarely have
title: Really Poorly Run Resort

review: I visited sarova Whitesands towards end of November with my family. On 20th after a aerobics pool class while walking over the pavement around the pool area one of the tile/pavement collapsed unfortunately  it was hollow and I fell into a hole and cut up my feet pretty badly bled profusly and one foot requiring stitches. What transpired during and after my injury is the reason I have rated sarova poorly. 1- Response rate was slow and they lacked coordination in terms of who to call for first aid and what to do. Clinical officer arrived eventually after more than 20min. During this time I was bleeding profusely and the only persons who stepped up to help were the pool attendant and a guard.  2.First aid boxes are not well equipped.ran out of some materials. 3.There were some
title: Abhorrent safety standards and response.
The hotel was wonderful  , the Wi fi was full it made my work easier

review: I recently took a holiday with my family a and one morning we decided to do aqua aerobics in the pool. My sister wanted to go check on her kids but as she was walking to get her towel, the pavement skirting the pool gave way and her foot went through one of the Stones which cut deeply into  both feet.She was bleeding excessively from the serious wounds. The pool attendant came to her rescue but the first aid box was ill-equipped; it ran out of cotton wool and gauze, they didn't even have clean water to wash the dirt out of the wounds, a security guard had to fetch some fro the pool shower. Needless 5o say the safety/first aid training the pool attendance is severely wanting.More over it took about 40 minutes from the incident happening to get the on-call doctor to come attend to
title: A safe stay with fabulous service

review: Went for a short break over my wife birthday. What a great hotel with huge outside gardens. We loved our stay from the beginning when we met Otieno would picked us up from the airport. After a quick check in we were showed to our room. Thank you for this lovely room overlooking the ocean. The room offers everything you need to feel comfortable. Dinners at the main restaurant were good and the chefs were always friendly and accommodating. Big thank you also to Katana who was serving us most of the days. Mostly we did spend our day around the big pool and the pool bar. Thanks to Enok and Venessa who served us our fresh coconut every morning. A big thank you goes also to Kevin and Nasryl who actually organized my wife dinner at very private area near the SPA. It was really super
title: Staycation in MagicalKenya

review: I had heard a lot about Whitesands as best in Mombasa esp food variety n taste. I was disappointed by food, the cuisine was very basic, not to a international hotel standard e.g Breakfast, no bread section (Frrnch bread , wholemeal), no cold meats or nuts or cheeses section. Dinner was simple blend, not even one day were my taste buds wowed. The restaurant were you pay had good food. Rooms are average in terms for deco n feel compared to many I have been. Drinks are expensive, especially water outside room costs 250 to 360 per bottle, really!, transport from airport is NOT complementary, I feel hospitality starts on arrival. Staff were very good I confirm, but by all means I had to go out and chk if I am actually at Whitesands! Especially food
title: Excellent

review: I have stayed at Sarova Whitesands beach Resort and Spa on many occasions and have always had a satisfying experience. As well as expecting the usual high standards that are the norm in any Sarova location I always scrutinise the security measures as that is my field. On arrival I was greeted by a member of the seucurity team and the location name was mentioned. I was given clear instructions regarding the entry procedure, we had our hands sanitised and our temperatures were taken, along side this the normal security searches were adhered to. A second phase security measure was applied prior to entering the resorts main reception, all bags sanitised and scanned.
title: Beach home away from hustle and bustle

review: Over the years, Whitesands has always been a favorite hotel of mine - although I have not stayed there in a few years. I returned for a visit a few weeks ago.  The welcome, hospitality, and a general sense of helpfulness were palatable. I was greeted at the gate (the first entrance) with a through COVID-19 protocol: my temperature was checked; my name and phone number recorded; my hands sanitized. At the entrance to the hotel, my bags were sanitized before being x-rayed. Through the hotel at strategic points, there are sanitizers. On walls, floors, pathways - everywhere there are reminders to keep social distancing. The seatings in the restaurant have been arranged to embrace social distance. Before being seated, you are directed to a wash hand station. It is not negotiable. You
title: Refund

review: They have amazing, fastidious staff, always on hand to help and work beyond their call of duty. The food is excellent, special mention to Jimmy, Timothy and Fatma from Beach bar, Robert, Derius and Jayne thanks for being on hand to help at all times, with no tinge of exhaustion.
title: AMAZING STAFF AWESOME STAY

review: from the pick up at the airport to the arrival at the hotel, the service was excellent. Staff were very helpful - Derious, Faith and the Operations Manager Anne come to mind.  There was a wide variety of sumptuous food. Was impressed by the Covid-19 precautions taken by the staff. Will definitely recommend to friends and the public.
title: AWESOME STAY

review: We had a time of our life. Best end year party ever! Great service from all staff, an array of fresh and tasty food, the food booths during the season were a great idea, esp for the kids. We had a flight mishap on the day we were to return to Nairobi, the management staff came to the rescue,went the extra mile, the small things that count! We will definitely return by end of year, I highly recommend the facility.
title: Operations and admin director at Coco Jambo restaurants Nrb.

review: I had the most incredible time during my stay at white sands resort. I was much overjoyed by the dance kitchen & memory game conducted by an animator CHERRY (Michelle Cherop) her service was Sterling, Tremendous accompanied by dedication & Tenacity  Gracias
title: Sarova Whitesands

review: Sarova Whitesands was a memorable experience. Friendly and intelligible conversation with the dining staff, notably pastry David Musili (pastry) , Faith, Everlyne (pastry) , Martha(ever on her feet), Levina, Everlyne (egg station) and not forgetting the indefatigable Manager Robert who is the most outgoing of them all, ready to serve even though he's a Manager Unforgettable and personalized Tulia SPA experience with amazing hands Ruth Ndichu (amazing masseuse) , the ever reachable and professional GM Jayne, who is willing to listen and take in critic. Room service honestly exemplary award would go to Daniel, who was a daily welcome ensuring timely on the clock routine room comfort . To be given commendation too is professional Lucy at Front office and Sharaz as well. Guards
title: Exemplary & Distinguished services

review: A beautiful place to be,the hospitality is on another level.We were really impressed with the great customer service at the resort.They all went beyond and above ensure we were well taken care of. Being in the industry... I noticed their emphasis on covid protocols which were being observed. The Food and Beverage was a notch higher because our eating venues kept changing and everything was superb!!! From food variety to service... happy faces all over. We checked out today but I've booked again for NYE... cant miss the Shomajodzi show!!!! They had an interesting concept of a food village and tagging us for meal periods during dinner... My take is this was the 'Genius'... I didn't feel congested, despite seeing so many people around. I chose to have my dinner from 7 since I had
title: Memorable Christmas,Amazing facility and even more Amazing staff

review: I've frequently stayed at Whitesands for business over the years and it's sad to see the  place become a  shadow of its former self. While  the rooms and other amenities are constantly getting a facelift and being improved, the customer experience has been on a steady decline. I had multiple hitches from check in-  the gentleman escorting me to my room got lost and had me dragging my luggage up and down  countless flights of stairs as he tried to figure his way out, then once we found my room he  spent 13  minutes trying to explain to me  how the lights worked (he seemed lost as well). He then left without actually providing the relevant information like WiFi and I had to call the  reception to have it sorted.The pool area  was always littered with used towels and I never laid
title: Best from the rest

review: Stayed here for a few days and I cannot express how thoroughly happy I was with my visit at the resort. The hotel staff have always been very helpful and accommodating throughout my stay. I believe this is what makes whitesands stand above the rest - it’s the people who work tirelessly at the resort. I must mention individuals from reservations and the front desk who made my booking and check in very pleasant. Consolata and Rajab were thorough professionals who went to the extra mile to make my check in at the hotel was very comfortable. Mr. Steve Kimani, the front office manager, was also very helpful and friendly during my whole stay at the resort. I must also thank Mr. Francis Msengeti who made sure my stay at the resort was pleasant and memorable. Paaras, Claire, Winifred,
title: An awesome view to wake up to👌🏿

review: My family doesn’t care for large crowds so this was the best time to vacation at our favorite hotel Sarova in Mombasa. The place is spectacular. We arrived a bit late but the reception was great. Our porter Kenyatta was very kind and assisted us into our room. Our 5 day stay was just marvelous. Nice clean rooms. The food never disappoints. Our son on special diet always found something in the menu he could eat. He was always accommodated by the kitchen staff. Anything we requested was made available for him. A big Thank You to the waiters, Daniel, Winfred, Kevin and their manager Nasryl for providing a comfortable  mealtime experience. The Covid Protocals were on point. Hand washing is a must. Masks are a must. Sitting and dining areas always sanitized. This made us feel safe.
title: Guest

review: Stayed here numerous times in the early 2000s so I’m glad to see it lived up to prior expectations. Well maintained establishment with lovely decor. The staff were very friendly and keen. Had the loveliest view of the beach from my room. Food was nothing short of amazing. All in all, it’s such a rare gem owing to its consistency.
title: Holiday in Mombasa after 22 years

review: We went to Mombasa after 22 years and decided to book in the Sarova Whtesands resort in Mombasa. Due to some issues we had to wait nearly an hour before we got our room. Paraas the Manager was friendly but refused to give us a room on the ground floor and instead gave us a room on the second floor so had to climb 4 flights daily. We were on half board basis and the food was good but felt they kept reducing it daily with less choices. There was no entertainmment as such apart from Pool aerobics in the morning and nothing at all in the evening. Staff were very pleasant and always willing to help especially Valentine , Ruth and Thomas who were always very helpful in the restaurant . Room was pleasant enough with balcony but had to climb 4 flights of stairs! Duncan cleaned room
title: Great!

review: I enjoyed every minute of my stay and had a great experience including a surprise birthday treat from the hotel.  Whitesands is a fantastic resort with excellent service from all quarters, from the reception, dining rooms, house keeping, maintenance staff and other guest services.   The choice of 5 swimming pools always manned by 2 or more lifeguards is great especially for children.   The food options were amazing at all meal times, with good variety.   My trip highlights were the recreation facilities, walking areas, comfortable lounge  areas along the beach and at poolsides with amazing views and the team activities in the morning and afternoons.
title: Beautiful resort with excellent service

review: I visited the hotel the first week of November 2019,for a holiday with friends woow we had real good fun time.I wanna thank our sales manager Joshua Awilli and Jamleck who took over while Joshua had gone for hotel expo in Nairobi. Thanks to Benard who made our check in and out flawless exactly like nothing else.My friends had small little angels thanks to Robert Kimotho who advised them on where to place their orders for their little angels which is minazi restaurant. In minazi i must appreciate Sylvia,susan,Ruth and minazi chefs  who took care of all the baby requests well.My friends were extremely grateful for such friendly service that made their stay easy. Cant forget Henry from banquets who did a quick set up for us at magharibi it was so relaxing me and my friends had a
title: AWESOME,BEAUTIFUL RESORT

review: Whitesands is lovely with great service, nice rooms and good location. But costlier than the neighbours. I was waiting for my room coz I arrived early. I went for a walk on the beach, then the guard refused me to reenter coz I couldn't give him the room number. He could have been a lot more polite. Since I live permanently in Kenya am very surprised that such a high level hotel serves such bad coffee. After all this country has excellent coffee. But u won't get it at Whitesands
title: Beautiful resort and beach, good food. Great value for money

review: The hotel is set on large property on the beach and is well maintained with a lush garden. The property was recently renovated and the rooms are modern and spacious, nothing too fancy but comfortable.  The hotel has many pools and restaurants and a friendly service and good conference facilities.   What makes the place stand out is a great value for money, cocktails at the beach $7, room service $12 and the snickers from the minibar $2. You can relax on vacation and dont have to go over the top on your budget.
title: Birthday lunch for our little princess

review: i returned this year to the sarova whitesands hotel and had a great reception from all of the staff. i had stayed there some years ago and always promised myself to return.the hotel was undergoing building work and also hosting a convention so it was extremely busy however the staff went out of their way to ensure my stay was comfortable. i cannot complete this review without mentioning a couple of people who stood out . sophie the excellent barista ( who remembered me from all those years back. the gardening staff who in all weathers ( it rained occasionally)  maintained the gardens to a very high level.
title: another great visit to whitesands

review: Just returned from Sarova whitesands and this being my third visit - and it only gets better each time!  A big shout out to Joshua Awili who as always goes out of the way to make sure booking is spot on and of course organizing another wonderful trip to Tsavo Salt lick.   Thank you to my very special friends at the restaurant : Robert, Lavina, Zaitun,Mercy and ALL the staff who work tirelessly in the restaurant serving us - making sure every meal is a memorable one!  Brian, Nixon and the whole of the animation team (sorry cannot remember names) - your entertainment is amazing,energetic, funny and so you are so talented!   I love your positive attitude towards your guests and may it carry on. Superb dancing from the whole team- you ALL were great!  Another great holiday and
title: Another Amazing experience!

review: Visited September 2019. Cannot fault this hotel. On arrival we were greeted with cold towels and welcome drinks. We were upgraded to a sea facing room which was clean and spacious, our room was cleaned every day to a high standard as well as turn down service in the evening. During our stay we used both the Pavillon restaurant and Minazi Cafe. Both of these had a wide range of food, we particularly liked Minazi Cafe as it was nice to choose a meal from a menu rather than buffet food every night. Coco's bar provided the main entertainment in the evenings which we enjoyed watching, the bar staff were excellent, serving everyone quickly with high quality drinks. We also used the spa twice whilst we were there, massages were worth the money. During the day we preferred the quieter
title: Great place , Very helpful Staff, Good food, Good gardens and swimming pools

review: Stayed here for a 5 night family holiday. Rooms have improved massively since my last stay around 6 years ago.  They do need to keep on top of the maintenance and cleaning to ensure they remain good.  Bathrooms modern.  The pools are all very good...especially the kids pools with a zero entry!  All inclusive drinks acceptable but could do with more i.e  light beer.  Make sure you order from the AI menu otherwise expect a charge upon check out.  Beach was clean with some seaweed but great around 4pm-6pm.   No hassle from beach boys...a polite no and walk away seems to help.  Kids club - really good with great staff.    Lunch and evening buffet very similar so we always took lunch at the italian place...great menu.  Pasta was amazing.  Tip: we always ordered our food here around
title: Great pools and food

review: Rest assured for my holidays! We love Sarova Whitesands! The rain showers, the breakfast, the crisp clean rooms....We would recommend this place to all looking to rest and have a treat. Looking forward to our next visit.
title: Overnight stay

review: Sadly we spent only one night at this lovely hotel, wish we had returned after a week's safari for the second week, instead we chose to go south of Mombasa. Rooms and gardens were very well maintained and presented. A basic buffet breakfast was provided on our very early departure.
title: Excellent hotel with a great animation team

review: I have been visiting Whitesands since I was a child. Unfortunately a few years back, their standards had slightly dropped. Due to this we used to visit other resorts in Mombasa. This year, we decided to give Whitesands another shot and i was pleasantly surprised. They have really improved upon all their past shortcomings. Rooms were very clean, food was of great quality and had lots of variety, pools were clean and well maintained.  Additionally, they have a great animation team that take care of you and organise fun activities throughout the day. A special mention to Brian from the animation team for his enthusiasm and energy.  I will definitely be returning in the coming years. I would highly recommend Whitesands to everyone!
title: Mesmerizing views of beach!

review: The Sarova Whitesands is simply the best resort hotel on the coast. We visited over christmas and new year and had a wonderful time. The General Manager Mohammed Hersi spends time every day talking to guests and always seems to act on reasonable suggestions.  Our stay over christmas was our 22nd stay at Whitesands in the last 9 years, we would not keep returning if we felt that it was not value for money.  The staff at all levels are superb and can not do enough to help you and make your stay as relaxing as possible.  We have booked for 5 weeks over christmas and new year again and can't wait to return.  You can watch some video of what it is like at:  --------  We simply love the place
title: Whitesands - Getting better each visit

review: Just returned from a 2 week stay at Whitesands. We had a fantastic time. Staff and grounds of hotel are of a very high standard . Rooms could do with a bit of a revamp but still a pretty good. Bars are very good but we found a lot of prostitutes at beach bar but they dont hastle you if you are in a couple but leave your man alone for 5 mins and they will pounce so be warned. Sports bar is a fab place to chill out in the AC and enjoy a few beers watching latest football match, high priases for Sylvie and Daniel top top top bar staff superb service. Pool bar is excellent place to chill out during the day. Beach is safe to walk providing  you walk along the sea edge and not too far. Pavillion restaurant food and service was ok but its' the location open air in the heat not good, we
title: Excellent

review: We enjoyed our stay at sarova whitesands, I, my hubby our two sons and our little baby girl. The place was very clean, food was alot and Varieties. I had a 8 months baby who was very well taken care of. They made every food I ordered for her, I had a separate baby bed in our room... and our stay there was fantastic. We felt a home away from home.   When we shall think of Mombasa vacation, Sarova whitesands will be our choice.. thanks alot for your warm welcome.  Young adventurer... at sarova whitesands 🥰
title: Fantastic

review: Had a fantastic time. Food quality and variety was excellent. Staff in the kids club and animation team were awesome, especially Nixon, Lucky and Lillian.  Perfect location with a great variety of restaurants and pools. Would recommend for a family with young children.  Lucky to be there for tree Christmas tree lighting which was wonderful.
title: Great Hotel with wonderful staff

review: From on set when i stepped my foot to the Resort ,the staff from Gate attendants to Askari rungu were generally very courteous and helpful,the Resort rooms have modern air conm which reacts to the sea breeze,If you happen to miss your dinner they have a late comers restaurant .. the bar waiter and waitresses kina Peter the petero, Brian, Joyce to name a few made my stay wow at Cocos bar.The madam who served me by offering a wet towel to wipe my face when was checking out may she be that way and for her gesture which is priceless have decided to come back with my family next visit soon
title: Roho safi Hotel

review: One of the most incredible beach resorts along the Indian Ocean. Actually I have been there not once not twice but actually i choose it among other hotels because they have wonderful services and facilities and their hospitality is unexplainable. I think you guys should visit Sarova Whitesands.
title: AMAZING BEACH RESORT

review: What amazes me about this resort is how they surpass my expectation year after year. I believe this is only possible with the individuals working at the resort by making sure each guest is given quality service.  From checking in to checking out, my stay at Sarova Whitesands has been pleasantly memorable. Staff members at the reception were very welcoming, friendly and professional. Hawa, Rajab, Dorris, Anne, Mercy, Lucy, Bernard and Caroline were always helpful and friendly in making my stay comfortable. I must mention Ms. Consolata who was extremely warm, helpful and friendly during my whole stay at the hotel.   The rooms are clean and well maintained. I did have some minor issues in my room but it was quickly sorted out. Despite being a few metres away from Cocos Bar, I was
title: Unbeatable!

review: Came here at the end of a hard working year living in Kenya and it was perfect. We spent our time by the pool, in the bar and had a pedicure as well. Not too many young children there so it was a peaceful time. Rooms were also spacious although ours was not ready when we arrived.   Good food but occasionally there was just too much! Friendly staff and we had a transfer to and from the train. Would go again.
title: Really nice trip

review: The best from the staff, food, rooms everything is amazing!  They provide a baby cot, food on buffet is great for toddlers too.  The room AC is great. They have Swahili breakfast Wednesday & Sunday, it’s the best!  We want to come back. We had the best time!
title: Excellent!

review: Julie, you recently helped me with my illness situation on the 20th. Thanks to you I had a very nice stay for the rest of the stay. You went out of your way by advising me not to rely on over-the-counter medication at the shop and contacted a medic who diagnosed me over the phone. The medication worked and was feeling much better in no time. I will definitely make this my go-to hotel in the future and will recommended it to friends. Thanks again for making a rather stressful trip to Mombasa so much easier! And, the light meal you ordered for the night was greatly appreciated as well! :)   Thank You for your exceptional service!
title: Julie you saved my trip!

review: Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort & SPA Mombasa, Kenya have a Gem by the name Chanice at the Reception / Customer Service! Chanice went out of her way to ensure we were assisted during check in, check out and our entire stay there. Thank you Chanice for the excellent customer service.
title: Whitesands have a Gem by the name Chanice at the Reception / Customer Service! Thank you Chanice.

review: Beautiful grounds, excellent food, amazing staff.  Greeted with scented washcloth and cold drink, checked in to a beautiful room overlooking the adult/spa pool.  Had a perfect massage overlooking the beach.
title: Wonderful!

review: Our first impressions of this hotel were amazing. Visually appealing, modern but also traditional. We were greeted by Elioud who was very helpful with a great sense of humour but was also very professional. We were taken to our modern room with beautiful air-con and we were thoroughly impressed. Only a slight problem with the rooms is that the fridge is not very cold, this could be improved. We did experience a couple of problems with our room, however, when consulted with front desk, it was resolved instantly.  There is a wide variety of things to choose from at the main restaurant which is always a plus, with very attentive waiters, specifically Jeffery who would always ensure we had drinks. However, as we were all inclusive we spent most of our time at the A'la carte
title: Quiet and attentive
best vacay spot in north coast

review: it was overall pretty amazing.  i enjoyed every minute of my stay there. I had a sea view room, and it was the best! The food was really nice. i enjoyed the breakfast varieties.  Please make sure you try out the pool bar.
title: Holiday of a lifetime!

review: What can I say, we had an absolutely amazing holiday at Sarova Whitesands! We stayed in a garden view room which had a secluded position with views of the adult swimming pool and sea beyond, the hotel grounds and pools were immaculate and the all-inclusive food & drink offering out of this world. But what really "made" the holiday for us was the warm welcome from, and fun we had we had with all of the amazing staff members we met. They were all outstanding in Coco's Bar (Ian Ian, Brian, Joyce, Esther, Maureen, Erick, Cecelia and Vincent) and also in Lido where we enjoyed many a meal and cocktail (Amina (The Captain), Nashon, Esther, Winnie, Pauline, Fatma, Venessa, Boniface (Babyface), Timothy, Kevin, Jimmy, George, Samuel and Joel) to name but a few - they are really a credit
title: Always a favourite
Nice resort but much expensive than it worth

review: Stayed here for a week in november. Saw a number of other hotels along the same beach, and Whitesands is by far the best.  It had an absolutely great fish restaurant by the beach, a 24 hour restaurant, and a buffet, which always seemed to have indian food. (Heard the chef is indian).  Alot of airline staff stay here, so you know the standard is good. Its a little more expensive but atleast you will be guaranteed a good holiday.
title: Great Hotel, All amenities, good food, and great service.

review: This must be the most over-rated hotel in Mombasa. Bad organisation, communications and poor rooms for top-prices. Only the food & pool is good. There are many hotel in Mombasa that offer much better value!
title: most over-rated hotel in Mombasa

review: We have just come back from an amazing holiday in Kenya staying at the White Sands Sarova Resort. Everything about this resort is fantastic, the swimming pools are all clean and refreshing and the staff are very helpful and extremely easy to get to know. I would urge anyone stayin at this hotel not to have any doubts or worries because it is a fantastic resort located on the Bamburi Resot and also has a fabulous watersports centre - Blue Lagoon - where you can go on trips such as glass bottom boats rides and jet ski hires. The food is completely out of this world and beware of the home made chips! Once you start to eat them you will never stop! Extremely delicious.   Thank You White Sands for a fabulous holiday!
title: Wow!

review: Stayed over Easter weekend. Booked superior rooms but standard were allocated. After complaining, moved after 3 hours to a superior room. Standard of room compared to other destinations/hotels is poor for a high end room and rate. Room cleaned only once a day. Compare that to Mauritius Le Meridien where room was cleaned three times a day. Air conditioning not working. Were given a lame excuse and told a blantant lie that engineers were working on it for the whole block. No sign of engineers or fix. Provided a fan for the night but not adequate. Eventually got fed up after 3 days and complained to front desk and lo and behold, fixed in a matter of hours. Food OK but main restaurant is open air, has lost the sea breeze due to over development and has no air conditioning. Fans are
title: Poor value for money.

review: This hotel has good scenery and they provide good meal varieties. The chef was especially nice to people.BUT,The room was not clean and had ants which we had to spray ourselves, we had to request  the roomcleaning every dayas it was not done automatically, at meal times flies were on fruit and no one covered them, the entertainment at night was sooooooo loud you could not relax and my infant daughter found it hard to sleep, the curtains,beddings and shower curtains were very old with obvious mending and holes, they gave my daughter a mosquito net with holes in it and there is general lack of maintenance or refurbishment
title: Top marks for the whitesands

review: We have just returned from the whitesands after two fantastic weeks there. We were told by some people on our flight out to mombasa that the whitesands was the best hotel in mombasa, well our impression was that this was in fact the case. The hotel was everything you could possibly want for a great holiday and more besides. The rooms were of a good size and cleaned everyday, nothing was missed off and our opinion is that if the rooms are clean and good value then the rest of the holiday will just slip into place. The food was sometimes a bit spicey which suited me fine, but my wife was not too keen on this, however she never went hungry as there is a really good choice on the menu and several different eateries to choose from so no need to go hungry try the burger at the lido
title: Bad Attitude

review: Change the menu,kindly have different types of foods for each day not the same type like everyday it was the same old menu, please try as much to change so that you will have more visitors and make more money :)
title: Food review

review: It was fantastic holiday we had alot of fun, animation team was great, Mitchell was the best, I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to visit, the food and the welcoming at the reception was very good.
title: Wonderful holiday

review: Am still here at whitesands as am writing this ....during our arrival on the 10th we were welcomed with smiles by Mark at the entrance followed by Rajab at the reception together with Ramko and Diyoniseus who were so helpful with our luggages to the room Thumbs up and keep up the good job. Since our check in was really early we decided to go for breakfast,coming back i met a very RUDE and UNCOUTH man from house keeping called Nelson from whom we asked a couple of bottles of water from and he went like "you don't have water in your room ?"........he handed me the bottles of mere water and i headed to my room. Decided to shower ...and there was no shower gel to add on it no bath mat ,no face towels it was a real disappoint...when i callee house keeping to bring them Nelson once
title: It was fair

review: My wife and I have just spent a week at the Whitesands and we had an enjoyable stay Our highlight was a drink and then dinner in Cocos bar each evening, which was wonderful, more so, as there were so few other guests dining there. The waiters around the pool bar - Joel and Lawrence were exceptional, with nothing ever being too much for them. Also, in the Lido, Amina and Julia were delightful.
title: Foreverliving yearly convention

review: I went to the Whitesands Hotel in March 2006 and had the time of my life. It was much more than I could have ever expected from a beach hotel in Kenya. The food, views, people, atmosphere... absolutely everything was AMAZING!  The staff were nice and friendly and made you feel right at home. They were very cooperative too, because we asked for our room to be changed due to noise from the generator and they were more than willing to do so. So we were shifted to the third floor and had spectacular views of the Indian Ocean, the pool and the bar. The rooms are a bit warn and are in need of a make over, which they are ding block by block. The pools were nice and clean and the food was also nice.   One thing I loved was the poolside bar and Coco’s bar. The cocktails were to die for
title: Had a wonderful stay

review: We stayed at this hotel in February 2006 and were very impressed, not least of all because we were on an all inclusive basis and did not have to eat pizza all week - see an earlier review.  The aim of our holiday was to chill out and relax for a week and we certainly achieved this.  The hotel is laid out in such a way that if you want lots of activity you can get it, but there are also quieter areas for those that want it.  Our room was great with fantastic views over the ocean.  The bathroom was a little tired but very clean.  All the staff could not do enough to help and were clearly proud of their country.  We had all our lunches at the Lido restaurant which overlooks the ocean.  It had an excellent All Inclusive menu, and we also ate there on two evenings using the credit
title: Mombassa Honeymoon - Worth the money!
Enjoyable stay although a few problems

review: My wife and I enjoyed a great time at Whitesands. Although the beginning of our stay was a little rocky due to a miscommunication regarding a room. The manager was nice enough to put us in the presidential suite.  Food was average but plentiful.  Scenic tour around the city and the golf kept us busy throughout our stay.  We would stay there again. Service was excellent and the staff was attentive.
title: hell on earth

review: We stayed at the Whtesands Hotel between 1st and 8th August following a 7 day safari in Tanzania.  I was concerned about the hotel as I had read some of the awful reviews earlier in the year and even tried to change the hotel, however I am very glad we didnt.  On arrival we were given cold flannels and a drink and made to feel welcome.  We were staying for a week, all inclusive with First Choice and were upgraded, at no expense to us, to a sea view room in the central part of the hotel (room 2053).  The room was dry and clean, comfortable bed, TV worked, mosquito nets without any holes and the only fault I would give is that the bathroom and decor is a bit dated.  The hotel was terrific.  The evening buffet was great, there was a good selection to a high standard but if you like
title: Brilliant Holiday - Excellent Place

review: This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. The room we were given was damp and mouldy, a far cry from the pictures shown on the web site. Both the telephone and the television were not working. Safe, clean drinking water is not provided on site and guests are prohibited from bringing in bottled water. When we attempted to bring in water we were treated like criminals and shouted at in the lobby. Mombasa is a beautiful place to visit - don't ruin your holiday by spending it at this hotel.
title: Absolutely Brilliant

review: Prior to going to the Sarova Whitesands I had read a number of the reviews on Trip advisor - needless to say I was slightly concerned and even thought of changing my hotel.  However, I decided to make my mind up for myself as in my experience there is just no pleasing some people!!!    I have to say I'm glad i did.  On arrival at the Whitesands we were greated by very friendly staff, handing out cold drinks and cool towels to refresh us after our journey.  We had to wait a while for the rooms to be sorted out but when we were escorted to our room I was pleasantly surprised.  I was expecting a mosquito invested hovel (going by some of the reviews) however, I found the room to be comfortable and clean - ok the decor may have been a bit out of date and it may benefit from
title: All Inclusive Package well worth it!

review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon after the Kenyan Royal Safari (which was amazing)   Once greeted by the reception staff we were introduced to guest services who were to explain our "haste free all inclusive package" Unfortunately the package is far from haste free. This mainly centres around the drinks option. The service provided to those on the all inclusive package was far slower than those who were paying for their drinks, to the extent that if we were at the bar and ordered drinks the bar attender would then take another order from paying guests, the drink for those who were paying would always be received first. You could only order one drink at a time, fair enough, well not really is they would only accept your order if your had completely finished
title: Nice Hotel

review: What a great hotel. We stayed here after being on safari for a week previously and were truly exhausted. Upon arrival we were greeted with hot towels and welcome drinks before registering. We were then shown to the customer services lady as we had upgraded to all inclusive and she told us all about it. We feel we got good value for our all inclusive supplement.  Our room was very spacious and spotlessy clean. We had a good sized balcony overlooking the pool and beach, great view. The room itself was a triple so we had plenty of space with just the two of us. It was air conditioned which was a must as it got hot, this dripped a little on the floor and we guess its the cause of the damp smell in the room, not a problem though just air it when you come back in and it beats sweating
title: Whitesands is magnifique!!

review: Whitesands is easily the best hotel at the Kenyan coast! I am still in love with Serena Beach hotel which I believe has superior everything!! Whitesands is closer to the activities e.g clubs, bars, and regional sports which gives it a big plus. It still maintains its posh appearance and room quality. AC works well and it's quiet (amen!) Serena is a little further away however the beach is amazing, and the hotel staff helpful and reliable. Whitesands has become my destination hotel because one can afford the luxury it offers and if you have not tried the suites... wow!  If you get the chance to travel to Whitesands go for it!! You will have an amazing time there!! If you want to pay a little bit more $ Serena Beach is always an option.
title: Nice but run down rooms

review: Always hesitant visiting a new place but my concerns were lifted once I alighted from my cab I was greeted by awesome customer service. Bonus I also got a room upgrade. The food was Great, the pools are plenty and if you like quiet like me there options.Will plan to visit again soon.
title: Best First Solo Travel

review: I have just checked-in at Sarova whitesands beach resort at around 19:30hrs, but the reception was not professional at all.Its not my first time in this hotel but i have not visited since the pandemic (covid-19)Today,  I was not briefed at all interms of Dinner/breakfast time. I was just handed the key & left at the mercy of the soldier on duty to show me the room.This is not acceptable!!!I expected to be briefed since we all know things cannot be the same since the pandemic & it does not matter if i have been here before!!
title: Disappointment

review: This my 7th visit to this hotel over a period of 15 years and each time I come its still a pleasant stay. The place has maintained its glory over the years, very clean environment, beautiful gardens, super clean pools, most of the stuff very friendly. The meals are so good, tasty and they have a variety. Only thing didn't get was some seafood which we were looking forward to. The meals outside the package are pricey. Otherwise overall was awesome stay and kids were overwhelmed with activities including the kids zone very reliable stuff and your sure your child is safe and very well taken care of with variety of activities throughout the day. Keep it up!!!
title: Perfect

review: booked in with my girlfriend for 3nights just to relax during the crazy pandemic, and even though we were skeptical about safety and hygiene ,the hotel staff relay outdid themselves. Lidos Bar especially was the highlight of out stay with special service from Jimmy, Esther and Timothy ,,,these staff members will make you feel like loyalty. They really went out of their of way to make sure we and everyone else at Lidos was well taken care of us..amidst the pandemic and the curfew! Thankyou Whitesands ..you've raised the bar way too high.
title: My All Time Favorite

review: Went there for work and I thought I could squeeze in the weekend to relax. The hotel is great,, rooms are clean and spacious and everything seems to work a it should. I would recommend for work trips. The hotel was full of NGOs and Government ministries having week long workshops  (I hear its like that most of the year) - giving little room for a fun atmosphere in the hotel. The food is great, the bars are great too. Nothing out of the ordinary.
title: Would recommend for work

review: We stayed at this property which was 20% occupied in the high season at an extremely agreeable rate. The election violence scared off almost all of their bookings so by the time we arrived, it was clear they were hurting for business. I have stayed here before so their exceptional attention to detail did not change despite the difficulties they were having. Great food, clean rooms and a variety of activities made for a great holiday. There are five pools to explore, jet ski/reef tours, morning pool aerobics and attentive pool and dining staff. Their menu is solid with v. few recycled platters from the previous night's buffet. My only complaint, and there is nothing they can do about this, is the beach. Having spent a great deal of time on the southern beaches, Diani to be
title: Great Stay
A surprisngly good hotel with first class amenities

review: I hate North Coast and my experience with Bamburi had left a bitter taste in my mouth about the quality of hotel in the area. However, this hotel was clearly a cut above the rest! I loathe large hotels but we knew that the occupancy was down so what better time to try it out!   Booked the hotel through the main Sarova office in Nairobi. The rates are incredibly affordable at the moment thanks to the post-election madness. We took the train which was pathetically empty and had few compartments, thanks also to the idiots clamoring for power. Where there would have been happy smiling children lined along the railtracks, waving, laughing and clapping for candy, there was no one. The kids were out toiling in the fields alongside their parents or herding cows and goats and not even
title: Tusker, Tusker more Tusker

review: Good clean resort hotel, good size pool, average quality food in restaurants (pizza better than average). Tusker beer served extra chilled at the pool /beach bar everytime. Some live music and occasionally alfresco dining. Beach not cleanest and thus uninviting but pool compensates. Watersports and diving aplenty.
title: great staff with smiles

review: The hotel is situated on the beach.  It's a beautiful hotel and the rooms are nice but you won't be spending too much time in them.   There are 3 pools within the hotel and there is a slide for the little ones.  We had a great time here and did most of the activities the the hotel provided.  If you like try out the spa for a massage perhaps.  They get booked in advance but definitely try it out.  There is nothing like getting a massage on the beach.  Now for the food...well there was a theme every night and let me just say that I'm sure we all put on a few pounds whilst we stayed here.  The food was to die for every single night.  The breakfast was delicious and the selections were plentiful.  There were foods catered for everyone.  We were travelling with vegetarians and even
title: Beautiful

review: We stayed at this hotel for our 40th birthday  leaving the kids at home for a week .   People and welcome . The hotel staff here are so friendly and helpful , theres always a smile and offer of help. When we arrived we were offered cold face cloths and a refreshing drink while our rooms were being sorted out . The entertainment team were equally as friendly and if they saw you sat around would ask if everything was ok and chat a while. If you venture onto the beach be warned the beach locals will not leave you alone until they have sold you something be firm and dont take your money or expensive belongings. Trade with them on your last day if you wish.    Food  This is the area where this hotel is a cut above the rest , each evening there is a theme to your food , but wether you
title: Nice location but overpriced

review: The Whitesands is in a beautiful location, but the hotel facilities are in poor condition and the rooms are definitely overpriced.  I stayed for 8 nights and had to move rooms three times due to the airconditioner or phone not working.  The rooms need refurbishing and many of them are quite damp and mouldy.  This would be okay except that the hotel charges such exhorbitant rates!     On the bright side, the food was excellent and the staff wonderful (with the exception of the grumpy and slow reception staff).  Tip: allow at least an hour to check out when you leave!
title: wonderful place

review: We have just returned from a two week stay at Whitesands and found it excellent. This is our third stay here and each year it gets better. Our room was spotless, the pools all cleaned daily & even though there was work ongoing at the Pavilion Resturant & the new spa it did not affect our holiday in any way. As we do charity work in the Shanzu area the manager Mohammed offers us a very favourable rate and always personally checks that we are ok. We are greeted warmly each year by Nellie, Lillian & the other staff . We find the whole standard of service at the hotel is very high and if you are going please try the new Pampa Resturant, you are in for a treat!!
title: Usual High Standard

review: Firstly I would like to say I have travelled the world on varied budgets and so would like to think I am a reasonable person and well seasoned.  I left quite a long review on the forum so I won't repeat myself just highlight certain points.  I mostly agree with the 2 previous reviews for October however to put it into relaistic and crude terms....  I and probably many others work hard for months on end to pay for a expensive holiday, preparing and organsiing and dreaming of the holiday so when you get to your destination and things arnt as  you were guided, promided or as advertised I would say you have an issue. Especially when you are charged very high rates for a good quality hotel with service to match and then its no where near.......  Just because we visit a poor country
title: Probs the best hotel on the coast-but a few minor problems

review: I have just spent one of the most memorable 8 days of my life with the most kind lovely helpfull staff.  The rooms were spotless, again a little bit dated but when you take the drive from the airport and see the poverty on route you realise how lucky you are to be in such a beautiful place.  Everyboby in the resort is so friendly, the food is great .  There is a lot of poverty in the surrounding areas but you still feel really safe. If you are lucky enough to be going to this amazing country and you have some space in your suitcase take with you some pens and exercise book and any kids clothes to give to the orphanages as they really need these sort of things and the kids are adorable. An amazing eye opening experience I will remember forever.
title: Happy Days

review: What a great experience, we have stopped in Kenya before, and so have our expectations set already, unlike some of the other reviewers who clearly are expecting European or indeed American standards. The rooms are excellent, although bathrooms a little tired. They are regularly cleaned, and everything worked as advertised. Room service is good if you want to stay in one night and watch a film. Lido restaurant great for an evening meal ( you do have to pay though), with a great couple of singers to seranade you. Food good and varied, we were all inclusive with First Choice, and the range we could have was plenty for our needs. You sit in a different table each night so are not stuck with someone for two weeks if you want to be just together. Pools are excellent, and there are
title: A wonderful hotel

review: We spent a week in this hotel in 2 standard-type interconnecting rooms. the location right on the beach is fantastic, but such was the lure of the 4 main leisure pools (3 of them inter-connecting) we hardly visited the beach at all. The pools are great for families, with a predominantly shallow pool with sloping access for little ones which also has a waterslide for the larger kids, which leads onto a diving pool and a larger shallow & deep pool with swim-up bar. There is a 4th, larger pool with a waterfall and island in the middle for more serious swimming, and a separate pool at the opposite end of the hotel in the "Quiet Zone" if you don't want to be bothered by other people's kids. It was hot and humid, but a cooling breeze off the ocean on most days and efficient aircon in
title: Very Pleasant Place to Stay

review: This hotel is excellent by Africa standards. The staff is very polite and everything worked. The air con struggled a little in the afternoon heat but was satisfactory at night and quiet in operation. The rooms are perhaps in need of a refurb but again this is Africa. Watch out for the boiling hot tap water if you have children. The various pools were excellent, as was the restaurant, though some of the food was better than other. The grounds are well patrolled by security guards though the beach has public access. You will be pestered on the beach by traders and potential guides ,so ignore all the offers of assistance from them.   Mombasa is like most African towns a dump, so don’t expect anything to do outside of the hotel except Safari. In fact I would not advise westerners to
title: whitesands

review: Whitesands hotel is rated  4  to 5 star. Certain aspects of this hotel would make you inclined to think otherwise. The rooms are typically african, no worse or better than some of the other hotels in the area although the bathrooms are in need of renovation. Having stayed on an all inclusive basis, the food was ok. The curries are particularly worth having. The staff are numerous but the service is lacking. You have to really get their attention if you want more than one drink with your dinner. The grounds are well kept and the silent pool/zone is great if you want peace and quiet. The Lido restaurant was good and reasonable value. A good place to stay for a weeks r&r.
title: Fresh white paint and a white Christmas at Whitesands

review: Arrived via Nairobi after one week safari to chill out. You can do as much or as little as you like. After breakfast in main restaurant, plenty of choice, did not see teenage daughters, apart from at pool, until after dinner in evening. Main restaurant for evening okay but tended to use Pasta Snack Bar. Putting flag up to top of short pole by pool lounger summoned a waiter who would bring snacks/drinks without too much difficulty. Coffee/Tea & cakes etc late afternoon very pleasant. 1st Floor room very acceptable with ocean view and balcony. Varied good entertainment around 9.30pm each night at Cocos Bar. Wished we could have stayed for a second week.
title: Excellent flexible facilities

review: Continuing on from (basic but clean,Jacaranda/ very homely Naivasha & Magnificent mara)  Well the end of the safari phase came to quickly for our liking but now it was off to Nairobi airport for the 1 hour flight down to Mombassa and the Sarova Whitesands Hotel. The flight was with Kenyan airways who i dont rate at all, they delay flights for the simplest reasons, ie a crew havent turned up but the crew for the next flight were in, (easy put that crew on your flight) Anyway thats my bitterness now done. On on our delayed arrival at Mombassa we were picked up for our 1/2 hour transfer to the hotel, couldnt really see much on the journey as it was pitch black 2030 hours. Arrived at the hotel and i must say i was impressed from the start, what a lovely sight, all lit up and
title: relaxation at the end of safari

review: Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort  We stayed at the Sarova Whitesands beach resort for one week starting 7th September 2009 the staff were very friendly and very helpful, there was 5 pools to choose from one having diving boards and a water slide which was fun for all ages.  Pool service was very good all you had to do was raise the flag next to your bed and the bar man would ask for your order. Food at the bar for lunch was nice and the prices was very good.  We never ate at the hotel apart from lunch times, but was informed it was good, all the restaurants are close but would recommend if female and on own remember personal safety if walking on the beach at night to the restaurants. We used a taxi to get to them just because we did not know where to go, but walked back two of the
title: terribly dissapointing

review: Whitesands is a gorgeous bubble of colonial luxury.  The staff are friendly and attentive, the grounds supply relaxed environments for all kinds of tastes, whether you'd like to spend time around one of the many pools or just relax under one of the palm trees to the sound of the ocean, Whitesands has it all...  Just remember that it is a bubble...  I took a walk along the beach after sunset and was robbed by three guys with machetes who were kind enough not to chop me up but took everything I had (watch, wallet, sunglasses, even my shoes...)  This shook me up considerably, but I'm hoping that my experience will highlight the dangers to future travellers and ensure that they stay off the beach after sunset.  Warnings aside, back to the bubble...  The food at the hotel was much
title: Whitesands is wonderful - but don't set foot on the beach after sunset...

review: I could go on for ages about this hotel and more importantly First Choice holidays. The only thing more disappointing about this hotel is the capabilities of the tour operator First Choice who were to be blunt an absolute waste of space!  List of issues.....          Air Conditioning didn't work.          Staff were rude and had bad attitudes.          Business people were treated much better than holidaymakers.          The all inclusive was not all inclusive and generally poor.          Rooms were exceptionally basic          I could go on all day.  The best thing about this holiday was the safari, which had nothing to do with the hotel but despite being away for three days and two nights we still had to pay for the nights that we weren't staying.  Overall it was awful, it
title: What a Let Down
Great Wedding and Honeymoon, but beware of fraudsters"

review: We have just returned from Kenya after getting married there in May 2009.  A fantastic holiday but we have just been made aware that our bank card has been fraudulently used by someone in Kenya.  We didn't use any of bank cards whilst in Kenya as we are aware of the bank charges when using cards abroad.  We took advantage of the in room safe which we thought would be secure as you have to input your own pin that no-one else is aware of.  We stored our valuables in the safe including our bank cards and made sure the safe was locked at all times.    We can only guess that the safe was accessed by someone whilst we were out of our room and the card must have been copied.  We returned from Holiday on 26 May and since then 3 transactions have taken place one which has been confirmed
title: well worth the journey

review: went to whie sands in jan ,first time in kenya really nice people,when waiting for bus to hotel from the airport u get youre first glimpse of monkeys running along the top of airport buildings.The journey from the airport  to the hotel takes about 30min and reminds you that youre in a third world country.The staff at hotel are really friendly and helpful ,watchout when you step out of the hotel grounds onto the beach the beachboys  will be round you rightaway selling anything,but they are good guys really,the pools are great, weather was fantastic,watch for nicolas he takes you or organises anything you want to do,               mick       newcastle
title: Absolutely Fab

review: If you want a hotel bases holiday then I would recomend this hotel, talking to other people it seems that it is one of the best around that area, the rooms are a good size with balcony or terrace. A/C could be a little more powerful but I suppose it is Africa. Bathrooms clean but very dated. The hotel grounds are large and very well maintained, with one small quiet swimming pool and one large pool with water slide and diving boards and of course a swim up bar. The hotel has a couple of bars and restaurants all of which are very good. If you like to take nice walks along the beach think again, the minute you step foot on the sand you are surrounded by locals, most of them selling things. In some places a 'no thankyou' does the trick but not these guys, however there are some
title: One of the best trips ever

review: We have just returned from a one week stay here, can honestly say we had a pleasant enough week although the weather conspired against us! Most days were dark and damp with high winds which made it difficult to enjoy going on the beach or joining in th evening entertainment which for some reason was usuallt outside where we were bitten to death by mosquitoes. We ended up going back to our rooms early each night as watching TV was preferable to this. Our room always felt damp and our clothes in the wardrobe felt clammy and smelt musty even though we could not fault the cleanliness and the service every day. The staff at the hotel were great - very well trained in customer relations and couldn't have tried harder. The food at the buffet was also good, there was a different theme
title: Pleasant stay

review: Went to The Whitesands for our honeymoon and got back on 21st October.  We only went for one week but what an amazing week and could most definitely have stayed there for longer...  I am amazed at the last review posted as surely these people must have gone to a very different resort to us as this makes no sense to me at all.  We had a sea facing double room - which was amazing...cleaned thoroughly on a daily basis with turn down service every evening. The bed linen was crisp, white and fresh and the Mosquito nets pulled every evening too.  The bathroom was spotless, supplies replenished frequently and the towels etc were perfect! So all in all - I can find nothing to complain about with the rooms.  Food: The buffet restaurant looked amazing, tables clean and crisp and laid
title: Great place, too bad I was there on business!

review: What more can one say an upgraded room, good food, good staff and very friendly a holiday of a lifetime and have told others have a few bob to spare this is the place to go, by the way just booked next year same place.
title: An amazing honeymoon

review: We have just come back from our honeymoon after spend 2 weeks at the whitesands. We cant recommed the place enough we had a brillant time. The complex itself was beautiful and the staff could not do enough for us, especially Michael the barman, Alice and Bridget at the co co beach bar, Naomy at the top bar and also Kalei who was one of the superviser all of them were amazing and were truly lovely people.   The food was nice centainly the food at Minazi. The swimming pools were nice and clean and you do not need to take beach towels as the provide them for you. The rooms were a little dated just needed to revamped. I would recommed that you take a trip out with the hotels taxi to take a trip around mombasa as it is cheaper than going through the holiday rep and they are safe
title: perfect hols

review: Some of the earlier reviews of this hotel nearly put me of booking - u can't please everyone but trust me I'm hard to please -a fussy, anxious bad tempered traveller and I loved it all ! If u can get it go all inclusive its such ruddy good value. You can use the A la carte cafe serving a great variety of sandwiches wraps curries, salads, pastas and pizza and more ! The buffet breakfast is brilliant - English bacon and sausages Heinz ketchup ! pancakes omlettes cooked how u want eggs exactly how u want.   Pools always have big comfy lougers with good parasols - service round the pool was good its not the fastest but the staff are friendly polite and happy to serve you. Some hotels give you inferior service if you are all inclusive but not here. You are treated brilliantly by all
title: Yes its not a spanking flashy hotel but it is Africa - beautiful, clean, safe and friendly highly recommended

review: I recently visited Mombasa. I stayed downtown at the Crown Royal. After a couple of days of sweating in the hot sun, I asked about going to a swimming pool. They put me in a cab and sent me to a sister hotel, the Sarova White Sands Beach hotel and spa. Wow, what a find! I can only speak to the poolside amenities, but it was an awesome day by the pool! Beautiful grounds, great people, great service. My stay there totally recharged my batteries for an overnight train trip back to Nairobi. I would HIGHLY recommend you try it!
title: Wow....what a Magnificent hotel...

review: Hi All.... we went on the 16/03/2010 for 7 days on an All Inclusive for our Honeymoon,we chose this hotel due to the positive reviews from this sight and the fact it was only 30/40 mins drive from the airport,this hotel was absolutley fantastic in every way,we paid extra for the Sea View room which was excellent with TV(live Premiership games etc...)and Mini Fridge,the food was superb and the staff were very professional and would highley recommend it.My wife used the Hotel Spa(Tulia) on a number of occasions and found it to be fantastic with exceptional value compared to the same treatment in the UK.
title: Amazing 5 days

review: great food, great service, 5 pools... just a great hotel =]
title: Amazing Grounds

review: Everything about this hotel is fantastic!  The first thing that hits you is that all the staff, regardless of their role, are genuienly happy to help and do it with a real African smile.   We had travelled with 2 young children 4yrs and 1yr, and were located a downstairs room, which made access easy.  We had a wonderful  sea side view which no words can describe!  The facilities included AC, cable tv(shows all English premiership games), free use of a safe in the room, free bottled water in room and a patio.  The showers were awesome!  The food was amazing!  Different meals for the 6 nights we stayed there, each time we thought the meal was the best from the last one!    The hotel is located within reach of a shopping mall, and a tourist attraction should one wish to get out of
title: True first class African hospitality guaranteed

review: This resort was completely full when we arrived.  It has a beautiful lobby. After a short delay we were given freshly painted rooms - the smell was awful, but we had no other choice.  We had Seaside rooms, ground floor patio, but the ocean is quite far away across a lawn and beach.  There's no surf noise because the reef offshore breaks the waves. The AC worked well, and was very appreciated - it's quite humid there. The buffets were varied and delicious - great service too.  It takes forever for the staff to clean your room though. Almost all day.   Comfy bed (firm like all beds in Kenya) and good mosquito netting all around it. Didn't see any mosquitoes or other bugs though. There's a bank machine on the property next door - only a short walk.  There's also a currency exchange
title: Everything was good
Good clean and efficient Hotel with excellent staff

review: Spent three nights here, having spent a week in this hotel in 2006 with our two teenage daughters. Now even better and our sea view room had been recently redecorated. The bathroom is a little dated (coloured suite) but everything works. The grounds are beautiful and sitting in a deckchair overlooking the ocean is wonderful. Pools are great,  extensive range of fresh and tasty food but most of all the people working there are so friendly, efficient and capable. We stayed in four hotels during our visit and none compared to this one.
title: Great hotel

review: A superb hotel right on the beach,ideal for relaxation and unwinding.The sea is lukewarm,,just like walking into a warm bath.Plenty of sun beds around the several swimming pools.We were aware of quite a few Russians,they seem to be the new Germans! Pool service was very good , if a little slow at times.DO take time to chat to the waiting staff,especially at the bars,we found them very friendly and helpful.The Spa is to be recommended,though not cheap Eg. massage at 5000/-.    Before booking All Inclusive,do the sums.Alcohol is restricted to the cheap local brands,in over 40 years of drinking,it is the first time a G&T has given me a headache!   The local Tusker beer is quite drinkable,but expensive,at 240/-, if you are not All Inc.( 90/- at  the local supermarket).    The
title: Relaxing Holiday.Good Hotel.Shame about Mombassa!
Nice grounds, limited choice of food, slow but friendly service

review: Voyager Beach Hotel, just down the coast, set the standard last year on our first trip to Kenya. We were disappointed, therefore, when Whitesands fell so far short of our expectations, despite costing more money than Voyager, in the Virgin brochure. On the plus side the grounds are lovely, if a little lacking in open spaces. The pools are plentiful and well maintained. The sea view is fantastic and the beach is nice, but good luck fending off the beach boys (very common all along this coastline). The staff are friendly (we must have said "Jambo" 20 times a day) and do try to help. Our bedroom was reasonable (although the bed was too hard) and the TV had a good selection of (mainly) sport channels. The gym was quite good, but by no means the best we have seen (especially lacking
title: Beautiful grounds, great rooms and service and the ocean - wow!

review: We've been to Kenya a number of times - visiting and safari trips.  We always try to manage a stay at the Sarova Whitesands.  Love the manicured grounds, the open and cool common areas and all the pools.  Lots to do for water fun.  Swaying palms with lots of shade and then the ribbon of clean white sand and the Indian Ocean.  We love it!  The service has been consistently excellent.  As is the food, especially on specialties nights.  My wife and I recommend this hotel most heartily.  We'll be back.  One note:  Be sure you know how the A/C works or you may have a warm night.  It automatically turns off when the balcony doors open, and must be reset to continue.
title: service a bit slow, too many conferences and american servicemen

review: This is indeed the best hotel in Mombasa. Although a little far from town but its worth the drive.
title: The best in Mombasa

review: The hotel is a 30 min drive from the airport about a 15 min drive  from the center of the city. It has beautiful beach and a nice buzz through out the day.. Good food with a nice variety of cuisines to choose from and has a great sea side bar to unwind & a small evening market. The staff is pretty warm & friendly. The rooms are nice & clean thou the bathrooms look old.. The hotel is pretty spread out with a Spa and has a number of extra curricular activities like water sports, tennis, gym, pools etc to choose from.
title: A stay worth the pay

review: Sarova whitesands is neant to be a jewel in teh crown of the North coast, but not any more. It prides itself as a five star last time i checked but it does not live up to its billing. this was perhaps the 12th visit i made to this establishment over the years and it seems to go downhill with each visit, the cost of stay however doesnt seem to go down at all. From the reception where i was kept waiting for 25mins despite having a confirmed reservation1 because their systems were down (sic!) to the rooms which are run down - peeling paint, threadbare towels, loose sockets ltd food variety to waitering service that leaves alot to be desired for the price i have paid, i dont think i will pay another visit unless i have heard that they have renovated the place, so for the time being
title: Needs Major renovation!

review: The Sarova White Sands Hotel in Mombasa  claims to offer "refreshing African hospitality" and indeed for the first 10 days that is indeed what we received. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. The location is breathtakingly beautiful but the hotel does require a significant amount of investment to justify a 5 star rating. The rooms are tired and merely functional / the air conditioning does not work well and the bathrooms are in serious need for upgrading.  After 10 days and following an enforced need to extend our stay due to the volcanic ash problem - the hospitality became neither "refreshing " nor "African" - instead the management of the hotel stated that for an extension they were going to more than double the room rate (from $100 per night hb which is what I
title: A relaxing a eye opening experence that came at a high price!!!??

review: On arrival we were greeted with cold towels and fruit juice, which was welcome due to the extreme humidity. The suitcases were brought by porters straight away as they showed us the location of our room. The room had twin beds with mosquito nets around them, fridge, kettle,tea/coffee, large safe, hairdryer,air conditioning,tv and phone. The room and bathroom were clean but the bathroom had been badly redecorated and looked rather shabby with bright yellow paint stains running down the walls and the toilet and bath still looked dirty although they had been cleaned. We had a balcony overlooking the quiet pool. The hotel has great facilities -  swim up bar in the main pool, active pool with slides & diving boards, watersports hut, Cocos bar on the beach, air conditioned disco,
title: Good facilities
Good Hotel BUT The Rooms Need Urgent Refurbishment

review: We booked our holiday at the Whitesands Resort through Monarch on an all inclusive basis. The flight from Gatwick was ok but with hindsight i would probably have chosen a scheduled flight to Nairobi and then transfer to Mombasa which takes about 45 mins.  Anyway back to the holiday, check in was efficient enough and we were allocated our original room with no problem, however when we got to the room it was still been cleaned! We were subsequently taken to another room that had just been prepared. The first thing that we noticed was the dump smell but we did not think much about it at the time - maybe due to the excitement of been on holiday! However the next morning my wife woke up complaining of chest pains. We made a complaint to guest relations who said they would
title: wonderful hotel
A hotel for all reasons – and all seasons

review: we have stayed at the whitesands twice now, we only came back on monday, but later today will be booking for next year. lt is a wonderful place we carnt fault it,  only one thing that makes my blood boil is the way asian guests treat the staff, it is appaling,  but dont let any reviews put you off it is fab,
title: Great for children!  Beware of twin rooms!

review: The food was awesome. I enjoyed the water sports (jet skiing was my favorite), swimming, and salsa classes at Cocos Beach Bar. Very good for family vacations as kids will definitely enjoy the various kids activities.
title: Water Fun at the Sarova Whitesand Beach

review: Having read some of the reviews on this hotel before my trip I have to say I was a little apprehensive, I am happy to say I was pleasantly surprised, the staff where extremely polite and helpful. Yes the rooms are a little dated but they are clean I didn’t find any problems with the bedding and the room was cleaned at the same time each day. The food was good and plenty of it with a good variety, yes it was self service but it was no problem and there was no waiting. As for value at $220 per room half board was not too bad. I would suggest though to anyone travelling from the airport not to use their transport as they wanted $40 one way , I got a yellow cab for $20, always check the price before you get in the cab. the internet was also expensive. All in all a pleasant stay.
title: Great Hotel

review: This is a good hotel with very friendly staff and brilliant gardens. The rooms are good but the bathrooms could do with a bit of updating.The food was reasonable and the choice was very good. Go to Cocoes bar by the beach for your evening drinks as there is always a nice breeze blowing in from the sea.
