Wanting to experience East Africa as a tourist for the first time but unsure as to where to book led me to the conclusion that some 5* luxury once in a while isn't a bad thing, hence staying here.  This hotel complex is just great, once you arrive...  Having been all over the world I've stayed in some hostile places far off the beaten track at times, you could say that in hindsight Whitesands was one of those places, due to the ethic violence surrounding political vote rigging at the time. No doubt my experience in Kenya would of been a lot better if the locals weren't slaughtering each other to death at the time.  My trip was officially cancelled but I managed to secure a
title: 5* Luxury - Bamburi, Kenya

review: I got an upgrade to the newly renovated Palm room which was pampering. The amenities, room setting...everything was lovely.   Try the Tulia Spa; i had a very relaxing hot-stone massage done. The masseuse was quite good while the gentleman manning the reception was friendly & helpful.   There is some construction/renovations ongoing but that doesn't interfere with the hotel's ambiance. Service is great wherever you go & helpful staff like Wambui & Alice are available to assist.  Will be back
title: Everything great!! Just slow for coffee I'm the morning - very slow in fact. But for location, friendliness, food, facilities it

review: Fabulous, dreamlike setting. Dawn absolutely stunning over the Indian Ocean...sunsets peaceful and beautiful .... Service extremely friendly, food great, beach bar fun... Gardens gorgeous, lovely pools...
title: Sarova Whitesands

review: The rooms are horrid, air-condition wasn't working and internet was unstable throughout our stay. The saving grace of the entire stay is probably only 2 staff and their work ethics, Hannah at front desk and Zaituni at coco's beach bar. Would never return to this hotel.
title: Terrible service

review: Great place for a group vacation or family with kids.  - Rooms: modern and refurbished, super cold air-conditioning which makes a big difference in escaping the heat. Samsung flat screen TVs, high ceilings, balcony overlooking the sea. BUT some areas of the hotel can be really noisy eg near the main pools the other end of the hotel has a designated quiet zone which is much more peaceful.  - Facilities: great watersport facilities reasonably priced and located. We went snorkelling, glass boating and jet skiing - all very well organised and conducted. Snorkelling was amazing! Lots of different pools which is great for kids but par consequence can be very crowded and dirty. Main Restaurant is vast and has a lot of variety (buffet) although the food is very commercial and average
title: Great place for a family vacation

review: The property is beautiful. Beautiful beach and the water is clear. The staff is very friendly and welcoming to visitors. There is a variety of places to eat from, the steakhouse and the Italian restaurant the best ones. The buffet has a great breakfast with a wide range of local and western dishes. Staff is responsive to requests. Easily one of the best resorts in the area. Will be even better once some of the amenities have finished and fixed. I would recommend it to others.
title: WONDERFUL WHITESANDS

review: Stayed at Sarova Whitesands for one week at the beginning of December. Check in took a while because we were quite a large family group travelling  to Mombasa for our sons wedding.  But was generally smooth and efficient.  We were all allocated the newly refurbished beach rooms which were very clean and maintained to a high standard. Lovely furnishings in the room and a comfortable king size bed.  Tea and coffee tray also provided.  The bathroom had a huge walk in shower with additional rain shower and the usual complementary toileteries, also very clean and modern. The room was cleaned efficiently on a daily basis and a turn down service was provided in the evening when a mosquito net would be drawn around the bed. The Pavillion main restaurant provided buffet breakfast, lunch
title: Lovely holiday destination for family

review: We enjoyed our stay there, though very short.... Would always do it again... Especially good for the kids as they are taken care of and parents can have that bit of holiday too... Lovely experience... To make by one self
title: Splendid

review: What can I say about Sarova Whitesands. From the moment of check in to check out, my experience at the hotel has been the best. The rooms, the food, the hospitality is second to none. The staff are ever friendly and always smiling. I was fortunate enough to come across several very friendly staff members who made my stay memorable. I cannot wait for my next visit to Whitesands. I cannot wait to visit Sarova Whitesands in the near future. My sincere gratitude and appreciation to the Hotel's staff
title: An experience that can never be forgotten

review: Stayed here several times- most recently last week at a conference. This is a great hotel in a  beautiful setting.   Food is good through the big buffets are a little overwhelming. The newer rooms a very very good good AC, nice fittings, excellent showers etc- and it's helpful that they have adult and child friendly pools separate.
title: Outstanding Customer Service

review: I have stayed iPad this hotel several times before and liked it, but yesterday,my otherwise good stay in the newly renovated rooms, was messed up at check in. I arrived at 430 pm and spent 1 hr 15 mins waiting for a room,  had prior booking but  they seemed to be fumbling to get a room, could hear the receptionist negotiating with someone on the other side on which room to allocate and the numbers he was being given all seemed sold... :((, asked to see the manager, who was not aware they were facing a near crisis.. Twitted about it and it was ignored!. There is a lot of room of improvement ..  The 1st impression lasts and overides all other positive aspects of the stay
title: Terrible check in experience

review: We stayed at the Sarova Whitesands Hotel for a week of relaxation and to celebrate a birthday and I have nothing but good things to say. The hotel, whilst completing the last of its renovation works, was nothing short of excellent.  Superb rooms (we had a sea view room and were literally 20 steps from the beach) with all the facilities you would expect from a luxury hotel.  The staff were friendly and attentive - each one of them had time to wish you a good morning, good afternoon, how your day has been and even chat a little during breakfast, lunch or dinner.    I had read reviews about this hotel before travelling to Mombasa and was a little bit worried about those that mentioned that the renovations somewhat dampened their experience but I can happily say that this was not
title: Amazing, Relaxing Experience

review: Stayed in one of the upgraded rooms (well worth the extra money) over New Year. Very peaceful relaxed hotel with friendly service (Redempta in the Tulia Bar is especially lovely).  A few restaurants along the beach are worth visiting and a shopping centre is just 5 minutes away by Matatu. The only downside is that it's not the best beach for swimming as it stays shallow very far out. Overall a good option for a chilled out stay in Bamburi.
title: Great option on Bamburi beach

review: Great hotel right on the beach. Good food and rooms. Lot's of activities near by including the mombasa marine park for snorkelling. The Mtwapa creek is round the corner for fishing. It has a holiday feel to it and is 20 mins north of Mombasa so it can be a little remote if you are more interesting in Mombasa city and it's offerings.
title: Great service

review: This is a lovely hotel and with a few improvements could be one of the best. Rooms are a little dated and were being refurbished when we went. Unfortunately our rooms were still be be improved. Air conditioning was efficient and was a welcome relief form the hot sun. All other amenities as you would expect in the rooms. Service was excellent throughout the hotel and from all departments.Pools are nice and clean and the service from the poolside bar was good. Lot of watersports facilities at the beach - these are reasonable priced. Food was buffet style but plenty of choice and was above average. The other restaurants we used for lunch and the food was good and served quickly with a smile. On the downside check in is quite laborious but that's about it.
title: Great hotel for a family holiday

review: After 2 years away, it was fantastic to be back at the best hotel on the NorthCoast !  The upgraded rooms are delightful, with high-class decor and super efficient air-conditioning and our room was kept clean, tidy and well-stocked by Daniel and his colleagues.  Not only have the rooms been upgraded, but the food in the main restaurant has also improved with something for everyone including meat-free, dairy-free and special meal requests taken on board with a smile.   Some things still remain the same however - the welcome we received from staff who remembered us, and those who didn't, brought a tear to our eyes ! The delight with which they welcomed us back and the pleasure they took in making our return special.   In the build up to Christmas, the hotel was particularly busy,
title: Good to be back !
so much potential - but need improvement on basic service delivery

review: The room I stayed in was the refurbished room and sea facing. Fantastic air con!!! Necessity for Mombasa....!!! The rooms were clean and spacious. Only issue with this place is the amount of  cockroaches by the bread toasting area. Had to laugh at the fright some guests got whole waiting for toasts. Also the vicious cats about. The staff were exceptional ... Wambui at guest relations, Geoffrey was Just a gentleman and peter the cocktail guy. Cannot fault this hotel besides the cockroach issue as off putting at meal times and cats with fleas taking over the loungers even the ones outside my balcony esp with cat allergy. Are these vaccinated? While there there was a rabies outbreak in Kenya so the last thing one wants is a scratch from cats all over the compound. Please get them
title: Lovely rooms

review: Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort & Spa, surely the place to be..Just to experience service driven by passion; right from the welcome, rooms, dining, entertainment, gardeners, security.. everyone! They have this caring attitude, and owning up issues to get amicable solutions.. all this with natural warmth, friendliness and professionalism.   With newly refurbished rooms being rolled out, the experience just went a notch higher. They live up to their endeavor.. to extend Refreshing African Hospitality.
title: Great Service

review: I have stayed at Whitesands many times, while in Mombasa for work or vacation. My experience over the years has been good. Staff are attentive and helpful wherever you are in the hotel. I enjoyed the tulia spa and the professionalism of the staff there. I'm glad to see the room upgrades, the rooms though very clean have had the expected wear and tear over the years. Looking forward to my next stay and recommend the hotel unwaveringly.
title: people

review: the people there were so respectful of us & each other. zaituni juma[my favourite waitress] was so friendly we went back to the coco beach every afternoon . she even gave me a gift [sooo sweet] i`ve never had that happen anywhere else in the world. really liked the 11 a.m. water exercises in the pool & the snorkeling in the ocean[interesting]sooo warm
title: "A smile from the gardener up to the Manager" Margrit B

review: This is a large resort-type hotel that looks as if it was built to hold large conventions and fly-in vacation packages. But it was off-season at the end of January and maybe had 200 guests. It has all the bells and whistles - great rooms, good beach, lots of swimming pools, bars and sunshine. Good security to keep the beach boys on the beach. We stayed on the half board plan (brekkie & supper) both buffet events with a wide assortment of foods (Kenyan, Indian & European). Give the rooms and facilities a 5 and the restaurant a 4 - good but nothing special -  details e.g. world's toughest lamb chops, cold tea at breakfast - they would do better to put the bags out and with an urn of hot water... Staff and service very good although check out seemed slow... The hotel arranged for
title: Great base for Mombassa weeknd

review: My wife had stayed in Sarova white sands days back on her vacation and felt in love with the food quality, this time we happen to pass by and enjoy the meals there especiallly during the kenyan night and breakfast time as well though we were not resident guests that did not set as different from others  Excellent service from the hostess unfortunately i dont remember her name as well as another excellent service from one of the waiters Katana who was very humble, attentive and proffesional will definately be back again soon
title: Beautiful, relaxing resort and great staff!

review: Thank you to Faith at the Minazi restaurant. Sweet girl with great sence of humour. Also, thank you to Redempta for inviting us to the spa pool. We enjoyed talking with you! We stayed in a newly renovated room with air conditioning, which was so refreshing as it gets very hot and humid in  Mombasa. The pedlers on the beach are very pushy, so we were thankful for beach chairs on the property where they could not come.
title: Christmas holiday

review: What a horrible experience.  Overcrowded and we had to fight for a room that was on the ground floor as i have two small children.  Pool was overcrowded and the food was really really horrible.  Never been go a hotel where we had to queue for so long and fight over who ordered the pancakes.  The worst was they had no tea pots.  Everytime you ordered tea it came in a flask.  Would never go again.  Stayed a new room which was vey nice.
title: Siagiruka

review: While a hotel is a hotel by any given standard, I believe the staff working at the place make a big difference. This was my experience at Sarova Whitesands. I have never met a more friendly and inviting staff such as this. I had many meals at this hotel and the friendliness of the staff was beyond the call of duty. May God bless the staff of Sarova and I do plan to indeed come again.
title: Friendly staff

review: Whitesands  x 1 night, Safari x 3 days, Whitesands x 10 days. On our return for the 10 days we had to wait three and a half hours for a room similar to the one we had previously not nice after hours travelling back from safari but it all got sorted thanks to Yvonne and Rose. The Ocean is tidal so not able to use the beach for sun bathing really plus once you leave the complex to walk the beach you are exposed to the touts. The renovated rooms are excellent and very large with 2 double beds in twin rooms. We stayed in both of these ground floor rooms 1078 and 1043 sea view facing. Rooms were still being renovated whist we were there so bit loud by the deepest pool. Request rooms away from Cocas Bar as can be bit loud. The pools are well looked after by Salim and other pool guys.
title: Enjoyable

review: My first time in White sands and it turned out to be exhilarating from the rooms,food,staff,pool,beach view & ambiance of the place it totally blew me off....My six day stay in Sarova was the best ever
title: Watch your bill!

review: Had a great two night stay in what is the best resort in the North coast of Mombasa. Clean modern rooms with free Wifi working well everywhere. Child friendly and memorable culinary experience. All was slightly negated at check out when my bill appeared to have eronious charges for room and pool side services, took an hour for hotel to agree the overcharge of approx 5000 ksh. Please do check your bills or pay for all additional services in cash to avoid lengthy reconciliations at check out.
title: 3rd time in Whitesands and would go back

review: I was unaware that the sea view rooms were the renovated rooms before arrival. I asked Edel if I could change rooms after many issues with my room she was not nice to me at all. Then, Michael the manager in Lido bar called Angela in order to assist me she was extremely helpful and moved me to a wonderful room. Halam, Wamboi were also quite helpful. My favorite was Ali the activity director who made sure my friends & I had an enjoyable time. I would go back but only to stay in renovated room.
title: Good

review: My experience was unfortunately less than stellar. This hotel promotes itself as a five star location, but I would give it three, compared to any other global or Kenyan five star resort. Here are the reasons: - mixed-up reservation and wrong spelling of my name led to check-in confusion and long wait time. - standard room is completely from the 80s, with brown/yellow running water (disgusting!), TV not working (was fixed), tiles/paint dirty. - clientele (tourists) are the charter flight all-inclusive type, and the hotel guard told me (totally unsolicited !!)  that it costs an extra $30 if I want to bring in a local lady. Really? It looks like this hotel caters to sex tourism clients. - Food: they have to cook/prepare food for hundreds of people daily, but for that the food is
title: Three stars at best

review: The hotel passed for some improvement in the rooms that became very nice, comfortable and clean, the internet is good quality, the bed is very nice, the new AC control provide a very good process to get a good temperature for your night, the bathrooms that was refurbished became very nice, clean and comfortable as well, I had a small problem during my check out, that was sorted out in good time, If i will go to Mombasa, for sure will choose Whitesands to stay again.
title: Perfect family vacation place

review: I went there with family and this comes out to be one of the best family vacation place. its value for money.   Very good swimming pool, connected with beach with awesome water sports facilities for kids and you can go for snorkelling. Very nice beach.  Hotel had good internet and food was awesome. highly recommend. its bit costly but worth your money.
title: Spent the day, did not stay overnight

review: The atmosphere is great I was working so it made it quite difficult but as a holiday destination clearly a great place.  The rooms spacious and the free WiFi great! The food was super and the general hospitality great.  The room cleaner was an interesting problem as the room was never cleaned at the same time in the day making my life more difficult. I would get my bed made up even though i asked NOT to be disturbed.  The reception on arrival was pretty poor and I had to ask twice for assistance and keys and directions.
title: Business trip to Mombasa

review: This was our first trip to Kenya, but from the moment we stepped into the hotel, we were treated as we were back home!   We arrived at 4 in the morning, and the detail that was given to us of where everything was and how things worked, really made us feel at home!
title: Fabulous hotel with amazing staff, fantastic facilities from food&beverage outlets to recreational options

review: We were around 100 doctors of all specialities who came from jordan and lebanon for a conference and relaxation at the same time. The atmosphere here is great at this time of the year....food and service are very good... And kenyan people here are welcoming... At night they have many activities esp the musical band and singers who are really dazzling. The night is so romantic near the shore... Reallt great place....and mosquitos are not as they said to us...u have to take yellow fever vaccine and malaria medicines begore u come but u really wont have a problem... I will comd back again...
title: Great place for relaxing and conferences

review: As a customer who returns often with work this hotel never fails. I always sit by the 'small' pool by the health bar as no children are allowed here. Redemtia behind the bar here is an angel, nothing is too much trouble for her. The staff are always smiling.
title: Quality everytime

review: I've been here twice, used their facilities, and eaten meals. It's clean, safe, right on the beach, you're not harassed (until you set foot on the beach), the food is good, desserts are lush, and the rooms are good.  The downside is always the harassment by sellers. I won't go back to the area because of them.
title: Good hotel & staff

review: In the context of a corporate event, good value for money. Old style 1990's , no real mark of differentiation. Good beach for morning walks, swimming pool good but with a high occupancy it can be crowded. When it comes to the food, a complete lack of imagination! Boring buffet , same stuff basically all week!
title: Value for Money

review: Two  weeks here, with a safari break sandwiched in between, was lovely. Mianzi cafe fab, choice of steaks salads, pizzas, all freshly cooked, and lovely bread rolls and butter to start. The buffet restaurant was good too. I really do not understand how anyone ever struggles to find an enjoyable meal, even if you are vegetarian. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, though I did think one pool assistant was embarrassingly desperate for a tip. It's a very poor country and wages are well below our minimum wage. tip little and often. I thought the beach bar and disco was a pleasant way to spend the evening. I have never seen so many prostitutes at a hotel, day and night. I get the impression this is turned a blind eye to. The only big downside for us was the persistence of
title: Great for all inclusive. Beach unbearable

review: This hotel could be very good with some renovations.  On the plus side: the beach is very nice, there are several pools spread out on quite a large property so even though it's a large hotel you don't feel crowded and the seafood restaurant is very good.  On the negative side: the rooms are quite old, there's brown water that comes out of the shower when you first turn it on and room cleaning could be improved.
title: Well done!

review: Stayed at Sarova Whitesands in December. Our room overlooked the beach and I believe it was one of the recently refurbished ones as it was absolutely stunning! Very clean and comfortable.  Their customer service was outstanding. This was my first trip to Kenya, I visited the country to explore my husband’s mother land. We stayed in many places but I have to say Sarova was my favourite one. In April I will be travelling with my mother to meet my mother in law and I know where we going to stay! I live and work in one of the top 5* london hotels therefor my expectations are usually very high, I’m pleased Whitesands delivered in every way.  I highly recommend this hotel.  Kate Kate
title: Relaxing by the ocean

review: My daughter and I shared some down time in Mombasa and the Whitesands staff did everything to make it a most memorable holiday.  Our ocean-front room was beautiful, the staff were outstanding ~ from the driver that picked us up at the airport to the last person that dropped us off to everyone in between!  The pools are lovely, the food was very good ~ everything is carefully set out to ensure a peaceful, relaxing and rejuvenating stay for all guests!  I will be sure to come back again and again and again!  Thank you!
title: A FABULOUS stay at Whitesands

review: Sarova white sands is a home away from home. First the reception, that greets you is just commendable you feel that you really belong. the staff at the reception are most welcoming, what to know how your journey was and then before you finish answering a glass of cool juice to cool the body. as if that not enough you get escorted to a new refurbished room  which gives you an excellent relaxation.the restaurant , serves all kinds of fresh foods you may want to taste. the staff here are excellent to the details and want to see that you enjoy your meals. keep up White sands.
title: excellent place to stay

review: We rated White sands for 8/10 because of the buffet variety,fresh food,free wifi and friednliness of employees.Grace who was the restaurant host was always there for us with a smile and Solomon our waiter kept asking if there is anything he can do for us.Wamboi the guest relation agent advised us on where to leave our kids as we excavate the Mombasa town.baby sitter are available and affordable even at night.kabibi was the name our baby sitter if I got the name right.
title: Best in Mombasa

review: We stayed at the Rooms facing the Beach they were really nice and our stay was pleasant. We would like to appreciate the hospitality of the staff over and in particular to the young lady at the Tulia bar who really made our trip wonderful and enjoyable. and our next trip Mombasa we will come and stay at your Hotel and one of the reasons is how my wife and enjoyed to spend our afternoon hours at the Tulia with Redempta. We will recommend our friends and colleagues to visit your facility and definitely to stop by the Tulia Bar (hope Redempta will be there).
title: The Best Trip to Mombasa

review: Expect a long wait while checking in/checking out, unfriendly staff, mass produced terrible food, outdated rooms and above all expect to get a room other than the one you booked. We will never go back there.
title: The standards have gone down so dramatically.

review: this was made third time, to stay at sarova, traveled last December, with my wife and, this time around we stayed in the upgraded palm rooms, which are quieter,spacious and very nice.  the customer service is top notch, breakfast is variety, staff are very friendly,...there was high speed WIFI at no extra cost, our room had a mini bar which was fully stocked.  most of the rooms at the hotel are now upgraded ( 95%), unlike last December, there was some renovation work going on, but you could hardly hear any noise.  enjoyed relaxing at the cocos beach bar, the animation, team has a lot to offer, different theme night, every evening, i enjoyed the Saturday karaoke nite....and the disco at club rhythms...  i highly recommend this hotel, its my home away from home....be back soon
title: wow experience

review: Sarova Whitesands Hotel is an experience in itself. I loved the place from the moment I entered the hotel till the time that I was leaving after 2 weeks. The service from staff who cleaned your room, the main hotel lobby staff, the restaurant staff, the Gym and Spa staff to the amazing A team gave a great service to my husband and I . I received an exemplary service from Grace who is in charge of the Tulia Spa and the Gym. I was particularly impressed by the Spa treatments and massages which included many types of Ayurvedic treatments. The hotel faces the Indian ocean which makes it particularly nice to sit outside in the sun with the cool Indian Ocean breeze blowing on your face. There are plenty of activities in the hotel for everyone and for all ages as there are 5 swimming
title: A five star service and a pleasant experience indeed!

review: beachview room and was very impressed. The hotel is just being refurbished and our room was superb with a most amazing walk in rain shower and you can even listen to the tv in the shower!! with all the toiletries you may need if you have forgotten anything, there was a mix up and our friends were placed at the other end of the hotel but next morning the staff moved all their belongings next to us as the room was now free. The swimming pools were amazing and always plenty of sunbeds available, the grounds were well maintained and very nice to walk round and nicely lit at night. The beach was very good and once again we dived straight from the beach with the dive school which was within the complex and very well run and the diving was once again excellent, although we did have a
title: Incredible, Incredible, Incredible

review: I haven't had chance to stay in at Whitesands but this review is for their Lido restaurant. The customization of their service for an event was excellent. My wife had planed a surprise bday dinner for me and it was the most romantic & amazing dinner I've ever experienced. As we approached the restaurant side there already was a waiter (Kennedy) ready to usher us to the beachside enclosure which was set-up exclusively for us with a band singing live music as we sat.  The menu was customised with my picture on it and the items listed were also selected and approved by my wife. Kennedy briefed us with the menu and helped us to make a choice too. All the food severed was made to perfection-the grilled lobster and steak was perfectly cooked. Dessert came with a bday message from my
title: Lido seafood grill

review: A lovely hotel in lush gardens.  The hotel is currently renovating the rooms and the renovated rooms are lovely.  We stayed on bed and breakfast basis and ate at a couple of restaurants (short walk down the beach - watch out for those crabs LOL) We preferred Antionoes Restaurant which was very reasonable.  Afternoon tea is served at the bar near the beach (free) with sandwiches and their famous biscuits.  Would go again in a flash!
title: Lovely hotel

review: Stayed there for a week here and loved the place. A couple of complaints, some of which are in control of the hotel and some re not. The one out of the control of the hotel is the people who accost you selling things. I know they have to make a living but its really annoying if you want some time to enjoy the beach. The second thing is that there are rooms without the card system and the AC is kept on 24/7 which for anyone who has a concern in environment or carbon footprint is a real issue. Even if I turned it off it would be on when I came back. Finally, the last day I was there someone decided to fix something in the room next to mine. I had to endure about an hour of banging whilst trying to hold a skype call. I understand they have to fix things but at least they could have
title: Our staying in Sarova white sand hotel

review: Resting over the white sands beach of Mombasa this resort with all the activities in it represents a huge turn in our visit to Kenya. Taken us from the wild safari adventure the open hearts of it's welcoming, smiling and helpful staff members put us over the silk of hospitality and comfort. No need to go anywhere out of it, despite the crowd, multiethnic city of Mombasa this resort is full of joyful activities.  Open beach,multiple swimming pools, sea adventures with diving and water motor games, evening entertainment programs, different varieties of restaurants and bars. Or just rest and relax and enjoy the breath taking views or visit the spa for full body treatment. Price is reasonable. In short, it is a world of leisure! Thank you Sarova Resort.
title: Great vacation

review: Beautiful place beautiful people with hearts of Gold. Why go anywhere else,.You are cared from the moment (Innocent meet us with a smile) you walk in to the moment you leave. Kids Club is thumbs up with people like Mary, Barbra, Carol, Fridah with awesome activities for kids.Waiter were super friendly, Ali, Geoffrey, Doreen, Moses. Evening Entertainment is amazing and Coco beach bar is nice and chilled out. Thanks Whitesands for the great experience I get each time I come.
title: If you haven't been to Whitesands you haven't been to Mombasa.

review: I stayed at this 5*Hotel for a fortnight from 17th March 2014....I had a fantastic holiday here, very clean, newly refurbished rooms. Staff are A1 and are there for you 24 hours a day. The Hotel Manager Michael was also on hand tending to every whim of all Guests!! Coco's bar is a must also on site, all bar staff there are fab....especially Cecil, Levina, Marceluis  all staff are superb I'm sorry if I've missed out loads of other names. Fantastic food, entertainment each night, many pools, many restaurants and bars and the spa treatments are a must!!........It's a must. I am going back again next week for a fortnight xx  Truly Amazing Hotel xx
title: Fantastic Kenyan Hospitality

review: We stayed at Whitesands for a week just before Easter and we had a wonderful break. It is a very good hotel with amenities to suit adults and children alike. I wish to make specific reference to the service we received at Coco Beach Bar, especially the excellent service provided by Zaituni and Karen. I will return back to Whitesands later this year.
title: enjoyable stay

review: Hotel in general Very nice hotel. It felt like a 5 star establishment through its ambience, the check in service, as it was slick. Told to take a seat in reception provided with a refreshing drink and cool hand/face towel while our check in process was being taken care of by the concierge staff.   As we were all-inclusive we were surprised that we had to sign at the end of a meal or drinks order except breakfast. There is no running tab, once you ordered something your tab was closed. If you decided you wanted another drink a new bill would be issued to be signed. As mentioned before we were all-inclusive and this became a bit tedious. Surely it would make more sense to have to sign for items that were NOT 'all-inclusive' as not all food / drinks are covered under the
title: Great hotel that suited our need

review: Been there for work and enjoyed it. The service, since I was picked at the airport, was five star, with the staff and management wanting to make sure that everything was ok. The room is spacious and has all the comfort and convenience. Facilities are great, and the bar in the beach is the best corner to chill out at the end of a working day. The only and small problem was the set (low) temperature in the room. As for the rest, would recommend without any doubts.
title: Excellent place in the beautiful coast of Mombasa!

review: This hotel is in a lovely location and the gardens are beautiful. I would not do the all inclusive again as it becomes a little complicated e.g. you can not have breakfast until 10am!!! you are also given a daft sheet of what you can have and when, I gave up!  The food is pretty average and similar to a Butlin's  kitchen and sometimes not very fresh. For the best food take a walk down the beach to Yuls, the food there is exceptional with decent coffee.  Whitesands faults are made up by its friendly staff who are always keen to help with a smile. The Spa is very good and Grace who manages it is fantastic, the spa offerings and very good indeed.
title: Staff make up for any faults

review: I had never been to Whitesands Mombasa before but I chose it for my Valentines weekend and wedding proposal.  I did not regret it one bit, she said yes. Great room, great food, awesome location and excellent staff.   Special mention goes to your staff Julie and Yvonne who went out of their way to make the event successful. They were extremely helpful and kept their word. Big up to Salif as well for the extra care.  I will definitely be visiting again soon!
title: Great Staff, Great Experience

review: Just spent 2 weeks at Whitesands. The hotel is conveniently situated on the North coast of Mombasa, 5 minutes from a shopping complex (City Plaza/Nakumet) and 30 minutes from Mombasa by car. We hired a car for the 2 weeks at a rate of 3000Ksh per day (around £25). Driving in Mombasa is not easy but taxis with a driver are available at a rate of around 5000Ksh per day. Mombasa town is manic , and for me not worth travelling into regularly. The traffic congestion and poor roads make it a very unpleasant experience. There is nothing to see in Mombasa town except Fort Jesus and if travelling across the ferry to the South coast.  Whitesands however was a pleasure and a destination in itself. The hotel has a huge sea facing frontage with impeccable grounds and very good staff. We were
title: A destination in itself

review: This is definitely the place to stay!   Everything was perfect. The buffets had such a huge selection of food, which was so varied for every meal. Deliciously fresh and moreish. The cocktails were delicious with their "Dawa" being my favourite The staff are so well trained and give flawless service with a genuine smile. The rooms were impeccably clean (which in our experience is very rare for most parts of Africa). I felt totally safe in the resort, totally taken care of, with great surroundings, staff, food and drink.   Couldn't ask for more.   Enjoy!
title: AMAZING! Everything was perfect!

review: During 18 days in Keyna I stayed at 5 x Sarova hotels. All unique in their style but have consistent staff commitment and efficiency. Thank-you to everyone at Whitesands-What a BRILLIANT team you are!
title: Fantastic hotel, Fantastic service

review: Have been staying at the white sands now for last 8 years . I love the hotel , it's relaxed atmosphere , setting and grounds . Some of the rooms have been refurbished which are lovely , some haven't which are more basic but still comfortable . Staff are really helpful but a little slow with service . Would highly recommend it for a total get away from life . Really enjoyed my stay
title: Beautiful relaxing grounds and hotel

review: This property commands an excellent location in the sweet spot of this area of Mombasa.  Although the road network is poor in the city, once you enter the property you experience a transformation.  Across from the property lies a very nice and expansive nature park with trails for mountain biking and hiking.  Very nice and safe.  The buffet meals are superb and the service is 5 star.
title: Pleasant surprise in Kenya

review: We held a meeting regarding a continental project here during Ramadan and it was marvelous. Though some of my guests complained of monotonous food for the whole week were there, all would want to go back.  For me, I still yearn for the fruit yoghurt and the carrot juice.  They took care of our Muslim brothers. Neat rooms, pleasant hosts - from the potter through the reception to your room.  Words cannot describe.  With any problem, just call your contact manager and someone will come to your aid.
title: Good to repeat

review: It is neat and clean place with well mannered staff.  Breakfast is excellent.  Swimming pools are clean and maintained.   Evening beach games and night live entertainment add the value for money.  I used to stay there almost every month during my official trips some years ago.
title: Great place for beach holiday

review: I arrived at 1am, 6th May. The bedsheets were cold, I thought it was AC. It turned out they had damp bedsheets(Rm 3092). My colleagues too. I caught severe bronchitis, and been very sick since then. The front office people appeared rather unperturbed by the complaints we all made. What bothers me is that four people took different rooms on the same floor and had the same terrible experience of sleeping on damp bedsheets.
title: Very Very Disappointed for the first time in 10 years

review: Another excellent stay at Whitesands.  The staff are so helpful and eager to make the stay enjoyable, nothing seemed to much trouble. We had a sea facing room that was modern, very clean and comfortable. The restaurants and food were good with plenty of choice available at all meal times. Thankyou Whitesands and hopefully we will be back again.
title: Excellent

review: Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort is a wonderful property. I had a beautiful sea facing room. The property, though old is well maintained. The service standards are good. The rooms are large and very well appointed and the staff is exceedingly courteous and nice.  We had delightful Indian food. The spread is huge and one is spoilt for choice. The music on the beach was fabulous. Overall, a great experience.
title: Great Experience in Mombasa

review: We spent 6 days atSarova whitesands.   We had a great time. The food, hospitality, view and staff ...everything was perfect. There is nothing that was not correct!   The staff goes out of there way to assist you. I would highly recommend the ground floor rooms away from the pool to maintain the serenity of the view.  I would love to visit the resort again!
title: A paradise!

review: Great food, clean rooms, great pools. Stephen and the other waiters in the Pavillion Restaurant dining room are always ready to help, but are not always hovering at your elbows like other places. We will come back again!
title: Relax at the beach with excellent service that is not overbearing.

review: This is one of the best hotels in Mombasa and is reasonably priced. I have stayed her over the past 11 years and found it to be consistently good. Spend a little extra and get a Premier Seafront Room and make sure it is one of the renovated rooms. Beautiful beach and view of the Indian Ocean.
title: Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort & Spa

review: The doorman was very welcoming.checkin was ok.The room was clean (2044) and i really loved it.The food was great!The issues started on the second day. we went back to our room at 1pm and we could not  access it as it was blocked which we could not understand as it we had paid.You can imagine going back to the reception and it was raining!Terrible.when we finally got into in the room,it wasnt ready.At 1pm and the room has not been cleaned?really!Actually the room steward had to be called to clean it.No apologies made.Then you have to keep asking for amenities to be replenished in your room.The restaurant staff are friendly,proffesional and very pleasant
title: DISAPPOINTED

review: Another amazing experience  We just returned from from a 2 weeks stay at the Sarova Whitesands  A little bit detailed just from the check-in experience Mr. Lawrence set the bar high with his smooth and detailed check-in nothing was a hustle and we were left with no queries to ask, Paul from the concierge was again a very experienced staff quickly grabbed our luggages,escorted as to our rooms and did the orientation in a very friendly and proffesional manner,coming to the pavilion restaurant was another exciting moments a big thankyou to Mark and his team cant remember all of them by names by bad but our special thanks to Kalimbo who did bond with us very well and would always stop by our table to ensure that we are well taken care of cant really remember our room attendant guy
title: Turning to be home Kudos Whitesands Team #3055

review: Was in for a conference and their services were excellent apart from their conference   which was not well arranged and materials and water not adequate but guess we were many of us and thought it's for holidays gate ways
title: Excellent Service

review: I checked in on 25th June and I am checking out on 29th February. The rooms are clean and the food is ok...hotel food. I felt disappointed when on my second day in this property when I dialled from my room #3029 to seek for room service. Ideally I requested the operator after dialling digit 0 that I wanted to buy a tooth paste. However, the lady mentioned to me that tooth paste will be delivered to my room as a complimentary. That meant that I don't have to pay for it.  Well, being an evening and busy watching World Cup, the lady called me one later to ask if the tooth paste has been delivered. I told her that no one had delivered it. So she said to me not to worry because someone was on the way. I waited and decided to call lady but unfortunately I could not get through.  The
title: Not Very Happy

review: If you are not travelling on a string, this is the best place in town. Kind personnel and beautiful beach. Clean and cosy. You can have long walks on the beach enjoying the tides and the sunrise. Recommended.
title: Best in town

review: Wow! Just returned from 3 weeks in Kenya, and the final 9 days were spent at Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort.   What can I say, at 27 I've stayed in my fair share of hotels, but this one is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in. I went with my wife and had 9 of the most relaxing days of my life. As a British Citizen, I must confess I had worries at travelling out to Kenya and Mombasa considering the recent news coverage and what I was reading online, but this stuff is complete rubbish, not ONCE did I feel unsafe during my stay in Kenya, and when you enter the gates of Sarova Whitesands, there's not another worry in the world...  Ok first up: The transfer from Moi International to the hotel was amazing, going through Mombasa Island itself. You see real pulsating African city
title: The Best Hotel and Stay Ever!

review: The Hotel itself is lovely especially the rooms  which have recently been refurbished and we were lucky enough to have one of these.  For the most part the staff were friendly. But I have had on going problems with my check out billing.  There was a dispute on charges for a dry cleaning bill which was not resolved - the receptionist was less than gracious.  I used my credit card to settle my bill, their card reader was not working properly so three attempts were made with two cancelled transactions made.  However all , three were charged to my account and it has now been three months trying to sort it out.  My credit card have been very good, but the Hotel refunded one of the payments  then wrote to the credit card to advise and took the money back six days later.  I only ever
title: EXCELLENT SERVICE

review: We went on the 18th of June and from the beginning the food was horrible, and despite several complaints there were no changes in the food (we stayed for 8 nights) and were served the same bland menu everyday everyday. The rooms are old and rundown, especially the old wing and the staff was so incredibly rude to us.we were a huge group of students and they basically treated us like kindergarteners, never listened and blatantly ignored us and everything we had to say.
title: Wow service

review: I checked in at The Whitesands on 25th June and was warmly received by the front office staff. The rooms are great and menu is all inclusive. The staff in this hotel are all warm and will serve you with a smile
title: Fantastic, amazing , love it !

review: What can I say ??? The perfect place to get married !! As we did. All the staff without exception were amazing ! We were very looked after, and couldn't have ask for more. We did pay for the upgrade and understand that we would have been upgraded anyway as we were getting married, but others in other party, didn't pay for the upgrade , but we given it anyway. We had amazing views of the ocean, and were near the quiet area, near the spa. All arrangements were made by the hotel, and they were great ! We married on the beach. We paid for all inclusive and it's defiantly the best way to stay ! Food and drink available 24/7. There is nothing more you could ask for. Really want to return, but can't travel due to restrictions to Kenya ! We will def return, I love this place, it has a
title: Loved it

review: This is definitely one place i would love to visit again.The whole experience was awesome from airport transfer,the shuttle was comfortable,on arrival a chilled glass of fruit juice and a warm towel. The bell boy very courteous, the dinner was scrumptious ,breakfast amazing.At meal times there was variety to choose from. Then my favorite part the jet ski experience,that was my first time on a jet ski and i loved every thrilling minute of that experience. The  sea side rooms were clean ,spacious ,comfortable with a very great view of the ocean was great and well equipped. The hotel grounds were well maintained. They have great staff and customer service is excellent. This is a place that is most definitely worth staying at.
title: Exciting

review: Overall, we really liked Whitesands and would return if we go to Mombasa again. We stayed for one week in February with our three year old son. The first three or four days they did not have the pool slide working which bothered us since we chose the location for the pools. We were still able to use the other two pools (not the quiet pool since we had a kid). I enjoyed the massage but felt the facial lacked the time it should have been given. The pool, restaurant, reception and kid zone staff all referred to us by name and we were always greeted by any staff member walking by. They could work on the entertainment staff poolside by offering more family friendly games but that wasn't such a big deal. We did not like our first room since there was no bathtub and construction so
title: Wonderful and relaxing

review: We stayed for three nights and didn't want to leave. The reservation process was smooth and great customer service. They picked us up and the driver gave us warm towels to refresh ourselves and chilled bottled water after we settled in the shuttle. The check-in process was fairly quick and they allowed us to check in a little early. Our room was spacious and comfortable with lots of storage space. It was equipped with modern amenities. The bed is very comfortable and I loved the mosquito net that closes around the whole bed like a curtain. Our room was in the ocean front building.  The resort itself is beautiful with lots of places to relax at. It wasn't very busy during the time we were there. We have a toddler and there are a lot of kid friendly areas. The Ozone Kids area
title: Wonderful Place to Stay
Great resort not so great beach!

review: Another great stay at Whitesands i almost went back but flight and acc was cancelled because off FCO advice .... was gutted...  All the usual great facilities,, star excellent .. food and beverages on all inclusive superb.  pizza parlour own clay oven cooked to order Tulia spa ... all fabulous ... go there next time  you get the chance... you won't regret..
title: another great stay

review: Went to Mombasa for work and stayed at the Whitesands Beach Resort. Staff are very friendly in all areas of the hotel. Make you feel very welcome. The restaurants have a wide variety of food for all. There are many pools to choose from be it to swim or just relax. Rooms are clean but looking a bit old. They were painting when I was there. Hotel is located right at the beach. Camels rides or boat ride available at the beach. Value for money and a great getaway from Nairobi.
title: Hotel at the beach

review: We stayed at the Sarova White sands for over a week and it was one of the best experiences ever. The rooms are nicely kept with great view of the ocean and with ample amenities. Some people might bother you with safari offers and artifact sales out on the beach but we were able to book with a tour guide  we had heard of from our friends back home. The staff were kind enough to locate the tour operator we were told about. The safari was great with slight problem regarding our accommodation.  The food at the Pavillion restaurant inside the hotel was amazingly good. With variety of options and the deserts are to die for. One complaint might be that me and my wife might have gained some weight :-) I recommend you go there on a full board and dine your life away. The entire staff
title: Well done

review: First time in Kenya and we picked the right place to stay. Room was fab. Clean and luxurious and over looked the beach. Many thanks to Victor, our room boy for maintaining the high standards. Food at the Pavillion was A1. Plenty of choice, well prepared, well presented and puddings to die for. Staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable especially Mathew, Godfrey and Geoffrey who always put a smile on our faces. Spent the evenings in Coco's watching the entertainment and cooling off(lovely breeze coming off the ocean). Booked our safari with our Virgin rep at the hotel. Rhino safaris did us proud. Our driver, Dullah was outstanding and spotted so much wildlife we would have missed. Lucky to see 8 Lions within in the 3 day safari plus many other
title: Fab Time at Whitesands.
A few steps away from excellence

review: I have been to Sarova Whitesands many times and I would say that the experience has always been very good, but, given the place, it could be excellent. Things that could be improved include the reception of arriving customers, the check in and the check out as these often take a bit too long. Also, some of the rooms smell a bit of dampness; I'm sure this could be corrected. Apart from that, nothing to complain about: the rooms are generally spacious and well decorated, the swimming pool is marvellous, the gardens well manicured and the food nice. Surely it is a very large place with a lot of people, but the value for the money is all there. Enjoy it if you go there.
title: Fantastic Service and Staff but be careful which room you get

review: We had a room with balcony overlooking the beach, I recommend it. The rooms are well equipped and kept clean and tidy. You will soon learn the word "Jambo" (hello) as every member of the staff will welcome you with this word, they don't just say it they are really happy to greet you. From reception to anyone of the 3 restaurants, from towel and pool staff to gardner's, bar staff and security they will all make you welcome. I always say that the way to judge if you like a place is to ask yourself if you will return? My answer is a resounding YES! Well done everyone, I look forward to seeing you again soon. I don't like to pick out any particular person for praise but this time I will, go and find Sylvia, she makes the best Cappuccino in the whole of Kenya, I promise you - you
title: Fun activities at Whitesands
living up to the sarova brand

review: Sarova Whitesands is one of those properties which provides something for everyone. Whether you are seeking a quite place to relax or seek a resort with plenty of activities (especially useful if traveling with children!!) or want access to a long long stretch of the magical Indian Ocean beach or want to enjoy local cullinary delights combined with classic multiple quality food options...this property has it all!  To top it off the service levels are truly remarkable and the staff are always smiling and friendly and never to the point to make a guest feel it is over the top! Reception, pool side, breakfast area, room cleaning, general...my experience with all staff was pleasant and indicative of the hotel's service-orientated culture which comes across as second nature.  The
title: Excellent!

review: Ali, Barbara and Jacky were most welcoming, friendly and they made our stay fun. We enjoyed their company at the volleyball games.  We also enjoyed their dancing and cabaret at Coco's.  Over all, we enjoyed our stay. The staff were great. The food was excellent and our room was nice and clean.
title: what a joy

review: Still  checked in and the experience so far is great from facilities to staff  The food is great Rooms in the new wing up to standard always ask for the new wing 3 pools which is great a spa  Serene surroundings Love it
title: Wonderful

review: I have been to many hotels and resorts but this one stands out for me the ambiance, the service the FOOD....... oh the food. The place makes you feel alive and the band every night during dinner is lovely. The plus is they always have a kid program helps take the kids off your hands. the place is simply well though. LOVED IT
title: Great Place

review: The hotel is lovely, great service. Had a delay in getting my room but it was sorted and the manger apologized. Most of the rooms have been renovated and they are really nice - great amenities in the room. During my stay there was a band and great music at the coco bar. There was a variety of food and fruits. The pools are awesome.   Hope they can finish renovating all the other rooms.
title: Fantastic place.

review: My wife and I spent 2 weeks in various National Parks in Kenya and Tanzania. It was a wonderful safari experience but we were exhausted by travelling and camping on the beaten tracks. Luckily I booked Sarova Whitesands for one week to relax and recover after safari. This decision turned out to be one of the best in my life. We had a great time at the resort without putting a foot outside the resort. The rooms were very comfortable, the staff very friendly, the service top class and the spa very relaxing. It was like home away from home. The choice of food at the main restaurant was great. We enjoyed the table layout, music at dinner and overall dining experience. The staff was happy to serve. Afternoon tea, sunset drinks and disco at Coco's bar was quite enjoyable. We made a
title: What a great place to recover after a bush safari
A 2 Star experience in a "5 star" hotel

review: I have stayed in whitesand before. My last visit there was 6 years ago and I expected the same this time around. Went for a weekend getaway with my daughter and 2 friends. First of all I requested 2 rooms each having twin beds. I get there and we are told they cannot provide that and they had assured me that they would. We got interconnecting rooms and one had a double bed. They promised to bring an extra bed to the room with the double bed and it took several follow up calls from me to keep reminding them to do it which they finally did 7 hours after we checked in. I have to also talk about the food. The buffet was terrible. Bland unsavoury food that was cooked without much thought. I gave up on the eating at the hotel by the second night. My six year old daughter hated the
title: Overall assessment

review: The hotel has good ambience for relaxing, good food and hospital staff.  The staff are hospital people and always willing to help. Bernard at the reception is a great person. The ozone kids club is great
title: Getting Old

review: Great resort for all (singles, ,couples and families) stayed for a wk in july with wife and son after a wk on safari , what a brilliant place to relax , it has 5 pools one with a water slide , and loads of bars and restaurants to choose from Cocos beach bar is great in evenings and has nightly entertainment , all staff are more than helpful at all times , has  a great spa , and you don t need to leave this resort for anything , well done to staff and management ! A big thank you to Victor who always made sure my son Zack was entertained every day (hope your keeping well :) !
title: African paradise

review: We visited the Sarova Whitesands Resort as part of our Bush to Beach experience with my boyfriend in September as his first visit to Kenya. This was after visiting the Mara. Whitesands gave us the best experience. We stayed at a sea front room and the view of the Indian Ocean and the morning and evening breeze was a great way to start and end the day.   I enjoyed the clean, almost empty swimming pool while my boyfriend played Tennis. There was something for both us- a land and water person. The meals were always hot and served in good time and staff are experienced and very friendly. They resolve issues pretty fast, we had a slight issue with our TV and it was resolved in minutes.   And we loved Coco Beach Bar, great music and cocktails. TULIA SPA took pampering to a whole new
title: Bush to Beach and the best beach experience

review: Whitesands is strategically placed and quite nice. The room was good, with a lovely view of the sea which is especially beautiful at sunrise. We enjoyed jet skiing and swimming in the 'silent' pool. It would ideally be a nice beach to walk on but the hassling from the beach boys. The buffet offers a nice selection of food with different themes which is interesting.
title: Relax and enjoy!

review: Visted this hotel after a busy safari and it was the perfect place to relax.  Despite the foriegn office warnings, we felt safe there, the hotel and staff were lovely, the food - i have never seen so many varieties of food in any one place, enough for a banquet every meal time, every day having a different theme.  The room had a beautiful view of the Indian Ocean. Everywhere was very clean, we had fruit and nice cookies left in the bedroom with the tea/coffee making facility. Certainly a place to recommend.
title: Piece of heaven

review: visited kenya in august 2014 and stayed at whitesands in our bamburi leg of the holiday. whitesands is a HUGE property with beautiful pools spread across the property. the rooms we stayed in were standard and nothing fancy but they do have upper class rooms too. in a place like this you'll hardly spend time in the room. the food and staff was also very good with different themed nights everyday made it exciting too!! since we went during a time where there were not many tourist the activity team wasnt very active, but it wasnt their fault as there were hardly any people to do the activities.   overall very beautiful property and had no problems at all :)
title: Perfect family re-union :)

review: I spent three days on a training at sarova whitesands, the experience was breathtaking. I was booked in an ocean view room; the rooms are exquisitely done and very welcoming. The foods variety in the dinning was diverse to everyone's taste and the service excellent. Being a walking fanatic, the walks along the beach from 6 am were quite refreshing. I would have loved to play tennis but was disappointed; where-by despite making arrangements in the morning to play in the evening the receptionists did not honor their promise to avail someone to play with me, nor apologize. The blue lagoon with the jet ski and boat rides made the stay more remarkable. The stay was wonderful and worth the investment.
title: Business or Leisure Sarova Whitesands got all

review: Hotel Location: =========== The hotel is approximately 1 hr. transfer from Moi International Airport during average off-peak time. Sarova Whitesands is located favourably in Bamburi , relatively near Mombasa town itself. Being built over large grounds, it boasts as one of the largest beach facing hotel in the North Coast and has been known for several years as a fine luxury hotel within easy reach. We decided to spend our 16 year wedding anniversary at this hotel and booked through a very popular agent in Mombasa town. The agents called Whitesands in front of us and confirmed our booking for the next day. We were given the hotel voucher and request for an additional bed for our 6 year old as well as a cot for our 3 year old were duly noted in the voucher. That evening I emailed
title: Truly the best location from Mombasa town!!
The beach and watersports were wow!

review: The beach was great, take a chance with the jet ski, it's exhilarating. The pools were fantastic. Unfortunately the food (no beef!) and unfriendly dining staff reduced my enjoyment. The hotel staff seemed overwhelmed by our numbers in a conference (over 200). The security was very good. My view from the room was average since it was facing other rooms and a small pool.
title: Great experience

review: Just returned from a Kenyatta Day break at Whitesands. Was expecting a long wait for the room not only as we arrived at 9 a.m. but also because we had the same experience during a family holiday in August 2014. Due to a problem with the door lock spent the whole afternoon answering the door and the telephone to hordes of technicians, security personnel and other staff, including some who  felt it necessary to use the balcony door. Had to have the room key card reactivated severally at reception. A change of room seemed out of the question as the hotel was fully booked for the weekend hosting wedding groups and conference delegates. The issue finally got resolved the next day. The refurbished rooms are well appointed, the water pressure is so good and the bath water is well
title: not special but highly enjoyable

review: The complimentary pick up from the airport was a perfect start to our 1st vacation with baby. Maganga the driver was so polite and made the trip to the hotel so nice. Check in was swift and the welcome drinks are always refreshing. Our sea view room was exactly how we had pictured it.  Being my husbands birthday, he received a surprise cake, that made our dinner more special.   Many thanks to Minazi restaurant for always ensuring we get the baby food on time and just the way we want it. It made our vacation perfect as we didn't have to worry about her meals. Home away from home. Dorcas who served us during our first breakfast was so kind we wished she was there every morning. Seif made our stay memorable, answered all our questions. thank you so much.  The only downside is not
title: TRIP ADVISOR

review: To all foreigners wishing to visit Kenya i advise you to visit the Sarova Whitesands you will never go wrong with this choice  My stay was the most memorable in my entire life  Guest relations perfect, room service excellent, house keeping, food and beeverage  wonderful  i commend the staff of whitesands for their professionalism and hospitality too   keep it up  MAO
title: My thoughts

review: Clean, efficient, dedicated and focused employees are vital to any firms success. i was glad to see that the hotel keeps it's staff well motivated enough for them to ensure absolute customer satisfaction. Should definitely be one of the top 10 places to stay in Kenya.
title: The best coastal experience in East Africa!!!

review: We are just back from our trip to msa, where we stayed at the sarova whitesands hotel. All the staff were very polite and efficient. Yvonne, Angela and Sarah at the guests relation desk were excellent at their services. Chef Joseph and Donald at the pavilion restaurant were also very helpful because we needed special meals,without  chilies and jain meals. Josephine and Seif in the banqueting dept were very  co-operative with us in organising the brunch and helping us to prepare the menu for the brunch. Our special thanks goes to joseph kimondo who gave us a very good deal for Sarova whitesands at the gateway fair in 2013 which we could not refuse and since then he has been very helpful all the way through. We all had a very memorable stay of ten days at sarova whitesands and
title: PERFECT PLACE FOR A PEACEFUL VACATION

review: After hearing about this place for all these years I finally decided to treat myself to a little domestic tourism and spend a weekend there. Long story short, I experienced terrible service from the moment I arrived to 2 days after I left (if you can even believe that!):  1. I was seated and left unattended for 45 minutes at the lobby when I arrived for no apparent reason. Perhaps because I was  traveling by myself...who knows 2. Once I was finally checked it, I was taken to a room with someone elses bags in it. They had double booked the room and it took about another 45 minutes to find a room that was unoccupied 3. Staff were slow and unwilling to help throughout the weekend, especially the people at reception.  4. Upon check out I was in a hurry to catch my flight yet unable
title: Great
Warm atmosphere as much as African people's smiley

review: Its long beach front is put to good use and the services available or of a high standard. Two outstanding features are the variety and quality of food and its ambience We had a set of meetings and were looked after very well.
title: Good all round care

review: The grass is overgrown, sun baskin beds around the ground floor rooms look like they haven't been moved for a while. When you climb on the beds they creek,the towels at the pool and the rooms are thread bear and  you can't control the speed of the shower. Tje key to my room is too bulky with the hotel name inscribed on it. Its hard to carry it around. Good hotel but they need to realise that times have changed.
title: Style up.

review: I recently stayed at Sarova Whitesands as a small relaxing day away from the busy city life in Nairobi. The comments I make are the same ones I posted on the hotels survey that they sent via email. Check in: The lady that assisted me was very nice. The gentleman handing towels was quite nonchalant, did not greet me and it seems like he was forced to do this job. This is even after I smiled at him and politely said hello.  Room:  Upon telling the hotel that I was celebrating my 30th birthday soon, they issued me with an upgrade. I was very pleased about this until later that evening when I returned to my bedroom and found that my toilet would not flush and water was continuously flowing but luckily not on the floor! Upon calling reception, they sent a maintenance man to come and
title: Lovely trip and good customer service for the most part!

review: I was at the Sarova whitesands in August of this year, i particularly enjoyed the food, that always had a wide variety and some special local dishes that i found to be a wonderful treat. Dinner was always served with a live band playing .  The staff were extremely professional,The beach and a choice of 3 swimming pools always meant that there was somewhere to relax. It was a great stay
title: I'll be back!

review: First comment is this is a lovely spot, with great hotel grounds on the best part of the beach, so there is a lot to like about Whitesands. The staff are by and large very friendly and the spa is very nice and well priced.  The beach side seafood restaurant was fantastic. However, I found the hotel lacked charm and certainly the previous gripes on this site regarding late housekeeping (most days not done before 4pm) and no beach towels before 930/10am are correct.   I stayed for 5 days, working, and  if I had been on holiday may have disliked the number of conference people walking around as this detracts from the relaxed atmosphere.  However, I must reiterate the grounds are lovely and it is big enough to find a quiet spot. Overall a nice place although not amazing. As with any
title: Good in many ways, but lacks the charm factor due to being too big

review: I stayed in Whitesands for Three nights (the best 3 nights) from the moment we arrived at the hotel to the very last day, my family and I were met by the General Manager Himself Mr. Raj V, to reception hospitality, room service, restaurant waiters and the staff in general.   I would like to thank Mr. Raj V (General Manager), Angela (Reception), Donald (Restaurant Manager), Masha, Daniel the list is endless. Thank you for making our vacation the BEST.
title: Great hotel, lacks personal attention

review: We stayed at white sands on November 4th and I love Sarova hotels. They spend extra effort to make the rooms and amenities extra nice. However on this stay I was a bit upset by the experience because of a specific situation. We checked in around 5pm and told the reception that we wouldn't be able to make it for dinner due to a commitment and if they could either give us a meal credit or lunch the next day. They said either was not possible.  On returning to the hotel at 10pm after our event we went to the Mnazi restaurant to order a la carte. The hostess asked us if we were there for "late dinner" for people who checked in late. Basically they moved over food from the main buffet to the smaller restaurant. I explained to her the situation and she told me that I should have had
title: Good Idea
Just magic but security must be tightened

review: The whitesands is well known for its great service and friendly staff so I shall just confirm that it remains a valid reputation. The views of the sea are breathtaking and one can completely relax in the soothing environment of the hotel grounds. Children are well taken care of, with a dedicated entertainment staff providing activities all day long. On the negative, Check in takes a bit longer than it should and the air con in the room we got was a bit unreliable. The hotel is renovating though, so that will probably be fixed. All in all a great holiday, thanks to a great hotel.
title: Good service, family friendly hotel

review: We had stayed for 5 days and I would rate this as one of the best properties i have ever stayed at. Good layout with 3 swimming pools and a pool bar. Really comfortable rooms and a killer AC. The food was really good especially the variety in the breakfast buffet. Would recommend it to everyone.
title: Great Place to stay and really good rooms

review: Stayed for 5 nights starting on the 24th Nov 2014 with my brother and wife. I was there last year also and hence came back as i enjoyed the staff and the hotel layout very much. First of all a big thank you to the entertainment team for putting up great events throughout the day and becoming good friends with us especially Crazy-David and Kevin who really made our stay outstanding. keep up the amazing work boys and no doubt i shall be returning in a year for an even longer period with more friends and family. Crazy-David you're full of talent and Kevin your company was appreciated. in fact all the boys and girls in their team are so amazing. they indeed made our stay entertaining and amusing! The tulia spa girls are amazing. they are very talented and do such an amazing job.
title: Always Impressed

review: Horrible. Unkempt rooms and dirty linen. First room I got had the previous guest's inner wear and dirty towels. Shower wasn't working and bathtubs were grossly dirty. Would only recommend a stay here as a last option.
title: Nasty experience

review: I'd heard so much about this place, it is truly legendary.  I was skeptical that it could live up to the high expectations I'd developed.  On the strength of the professional yet friendly staff, the well maintained grounds, gardens, and pools, the clean, well-appointed rooms, amenities, location, fine cuisine,  white sand beach, entertainment and attention to details, I was not disappointed. I entertained my in-laws there, who were equally impressed.  It's the real deal!  I'll be back in 2015.
title: Sure to Please

review: a great place to spend a holiday with family, and children, ideally located on the indian ocean,with attractions for all age groups, from toddlers to grand parents, excellent staff, good food, great entertainment,well maintained beach front, the right place for a relaxed holiday.
title: first visit-not the last one!

review: I returned to whitesands after many years, just for an overnight stay. Still a lovely hotel, with nice layout for holiday relaxation and conferences. The service is good and the staff quite helpful. This time I arrived late in the night and had to leave early for meetings -- the check in and out process could be more efficient.   I was quite disappointed by the room service staff insisting that I should take the late night buffet for dinner, which turned out to have limited food choices - not necessarily the choices a guest may want late in the night. I was allocated a very big room with two double beds and what seemed like a dump of furniture. The room was not properly cleaned - the floors were dusty. I politely inquired whether there was no better room and the check-in lady
title: Nice holiday resort

review: A beautiful large property spread of beautiful flora and fauna and coconut trees.....huge swimming pool, lovely dining rooms, my bedroom too was beautiful, stayed there for a week and absolutely loved every bit of my stay.  The staff are very friendly and hospitable too.  Loved the evening entertainment of various dances, the disco.......right on the sea....so enjoyed listening to the waves in the night......
title: Exotic

review: I had been to whitesand beach resort in 2011-12 for 500 days at a stretch in same room of course with intermittent gap of a week or so for out stationed assignments. My stay was so comfortable & awe inspiring that I became an uncalled member of the hotel, never I was inconvenienced to think even for a change of stay and moreover the overall hospitality was so warm that I being in a hotel have never fallen sick. day & nights were full of entertainments & if you can involve you may cherish the beauty, sip the enjoyment & devour the natural beauty after a week end spa treatment. The food was mouth watering & you chose where you want to dine.... Last but not the least, on saturday you can enjoy singing by yourself if you can perform in coco bar beach side, as I was a regular
title: THE RESORT IN BEACH IS ONLY OPTION FOR YOU TO RELAX & REJUVENATE YOURSELF

review: We have been going to Whitesands hotel regularly for the past 26 years. Every time we visit Mombasa its our first option. Back there again this year in July. Got to stay in newly renovated rooms. They were very nice but had a few problems with the air conditioner and eventually had to move rooms. Staff were very concerned and did their best to help out. Food was great. Loved,loved the Swahili breakfast... more of that please
title: Excellent Family Vacation Hotel
Cool down at the swim up pool bar

review: Even after going to Whitesands for so many years, last week was my first time in the adult pool! We are normally parked by the kids pool with the slide.  The bar stools are submerged waist height in the pool, the bartenders are friendly and the music is loud and hip, what's not to love??????
title: True Family Holiday

review: Let me start this review by saying that my 18 month old son had the time of his life at the hotel and so did I. There is so much to do there without even stepping out of the hotel. But if you are looking for peace and tranquility, i would suggest look for a hotel in the south.  First the good bit, the food's excellent, the location's great, staff's great  and there is plenty to do here. There is the kids pool, a kids playroom and plenty of other things that will keep your kids occupied while you can have drink in peace.  Now not so good bit. The beach is buzzing with activity and sometimes and just sometimes you might feel that there is too much happening. As soon as you get on to the beach there is somebody or the other trying to sell you something. Personally i did not take
title: A relaxing time

review: We were re-visiting the hotel after our HoneyMoon of 10 years ago. This was a family holiday and we waited a bit for check in. Rooms were too far away and they had sand in the bed... although the same was sorted. Kudos to the kids club, my kids had fun there. Food was excellent and also the Mnazi Restaurant served us great italian food. If there were better choices along the coast this hotel would a run for its money. I hope they improve. All said and done my kids loved the place.. and i am sure i will visit again.
title: It could have been better!!

review: Got marryed here and I must say it was the best 2 weeks we've ever had  Hotel was amazing  Food was really good and they have the best steak sandwich I've ever tasted ,seafood restaurant was awesome and very large portions  The rooms are clean and tidy ,not state off the art ,but then you don't go on holiday to spend it in your room ,we even had to buy some lollipops for the monkeys who use to sit and wait on the balcony for there morning lolly Must name a few of the staff ,as nothing was ever too much Moses  waiter as pool  Womboie wedding planner David entertainment  And all the kids club ,who I must say entertained our kids all day and evening ,they couldn't wait to go mornings and my kids never ever enjoyed a kids club in the last 10 years,even the guys at the dive center
title: Awesome experience

review: So I recently stayed at the Hotel in August 22 to August 28 2014. It seemed to be a very busy time for themas the hotel was operating on full occupancy that weekend . We were given room 3001 and 3002 which have obviously seen better days  and so we asked to be upgraded. Ibrahim at the reception was very helpful was this and the newly refurbished rooms were very comfortable and modern. A whole world of difference. The food was good, the service was good and the staff very helpful.I preferred swimming at the Tulia Spa Pool as it was very quiet and conducive. Overall a great stay.
title: The Place to Be
