review: Its a perfect place for your family exspecially if you have children the hotel is field with amazing things to do, the hotel has  fantastic rooms and has has direct entry to the beach it is quite the best hotel in the area
title: Average

review: Sufficiently clean, neat rooms. They are renovating the rooms so there can be some hiccups with the rooms. Key lock was not working in my first room. Second room had no safety lock. Breakfast is served from 7am so if you need to take off earlier there is a bare minimum option available from 6am. The gym equipment could use a facelift; still it serves the purpose. There strength is the staff offering attentive and fast service.
title: Adequate

review: It was most beautiful hotel, i have seen. It has a amazing nature , nice pool... Beach is not good. Lots of people disturbed us. I had some problem about internet. In my room wifi doesnt work. We dont like dinner cuz we dont have a option more. But i can go again just for nature cuz its wonderful.
title: Amazing nature...

review: In November we stayed at this hotel for the 20th time. I think that will say enough about how much we like this hotel. The staff are always doing everything for us to get us to enjoy our stay.  The cleaning of the room is excellent and the cleaner boy always fix everything we wish.
title: Nice staff.

review: After arriving at 2pm -- well after check-out time -- we were told our rooms weren't ready and we had to wait 3 HOURS before we could enter the room we booked. We expected we would receive a discount or maybe a free dinner because of this crazy wait. We were wrong.  The beach is crawling with vendors and isn't even worth going on. The Indian ocean is beautiful, but there are no lounge chairs on the beach and no servers to get drinks. If you stay here, you will likely never step foot on the sand. Especially because of the persistent vendors.  The rooms are very nice! I mean this! Though mine was next to the housekeeping storage room (making it difficult to stay asleep in the early morning), my TV wouldn't work, and 3 of my light bulbs were missing, the room was very classy and
title: After years of being the #1 hotel in Mombasa, complacentcy has raged in.
Severe deterioration in standards, very noisy, not suitable for families or businesspeople

review: There is nothing else I and my family could have asked for. Absolutely fantastic. I wish I had known about this place when I was still in London. The trip from Wellington New Zealand was very very long, but the experience, comfort, luxury, food, security, and most importantly customer service is first class. Highly recommend, and I will surely be there again next year.Its a place you go to, and really don't need to bother about another vacation location. It has everything that makes you almost want to live there. Please keep up the good work management. A+++++++++++++++
title: Absolutely first class

review: sarova is a place to never forget. my family and I went there vacationing and we regret returning early back to our hometown. we had so much fun there that we added a couple of days from our usual plan...on our stay in mombassa we stayed in an another resort. we stayed at sarova after the resort and it was nothing compared to sarova....
title: a place to never forget

review: While attending a conference, I stayed at the hotel for a few days in early December 2014.  The hotel itself is great- beautiful grounds, nice pools, great food, good conference facilities, and a nice gym. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms however, are in desperate need of an upgrade. Some, anyway. The rooms by the spa seem to have been renovated and are lovely- the one I stayed in, however, needed a good paint job, and a new bathroom. Old, cracked tiles, mold all over the ceiling, musty, moldy smell, doors that don't close... It's still one of the best options in the area- just make sure you get a newly renovated room!
title: Rooms in desperate need for an upgrade!

review: Stayed here over new years eve.....splendid stay.....the place to be,loved the dinner set up at the beach...the DJ was amazing n got us to our feet ....but where did the fireworks go to? The pools really cool,great staff,the food is awesome......This is the place to be......will be back soon....
title: Another Heaven

review: What a beautiful hotel, staff all so friendly and the views were breathtaking, plenty to do on site but was a beautiful place to relax, the infinity pool was out of this world. Everywhere was clean and tidy, rooms were airy and clean and good sizes. Right on the beach and as long as you don't mind being chased by the boys on the beach touting for business you'll be fine. Would highly recommend and would go back.
title: Awesome stay

review: Visited in October 2014 and loved this resort. Food was plentiful and varied with great vegetarian options. Lots of fruit at breakfast. Grounds looked beautiful and room had a view of the gorgeous Indian ocean. Beach is public so expect local sellers, but handy if you want some fresh coconut water. There are jet skis on offer (additional cost) which we didn't try. Loved playing sports like tennis, waterpolo and table tennis in the resort (free). Rooms were big, clean, comfortable and luxurious with big beds and WIFI and most importantly... had a full length mirror! Staff were very friendly and helpful eg. bringing an umbrella when it started raining heavily when we were playing tennis, playing table tennis with me when I had no partner and friendly waiters in the restaurant.
title: Lovely Resort

review: The view of the ocean is just spectacular. Sarova has the longest coastline.  And the sand, it actually lives by the name. Sarova Whitesands. The water sporting options available are amazing Very good customer service. All the way from when you book your holiday trip, your arrival, your stay, comfort and departure. Margaret at the reception thank you very much The rooms are spacious and well maintained.
title: Good hotel for both business and leisure

review: As the name suggests, its situated on a beautiful white sandy beach. The hotel has great facilities,  very nice rooms,  and great food.  There are several restaurants to choose from within the hotel and the service is great.   I highly recommend this hotel.
title: Amazing hotel

review: My Son got married on Bamburi beach. The Whitesands is the best hotel I have ever stayed in the hotel is in acres of a beautiful garden's. The hotel rooms are very clean we had am ocean view room amazing. We were all inclusive the food was delisious. Staff were very friendly and always smiling and helpful. All in all great holiday.
title: Unmatched Customer Experience-Fantastic memorable moments

review: I was here on a business trip but I could see that would also be a great place to bring my family. The service was excellent, the room clean and well equipped and the food was great. I thought the buffet was excellent - a really good fresh selection of food. With the beach on the doorstep, pools (and kids pools), a nice gym, a sandy play area for little ones, this place can cater for both business and pleasure and it does so very well indeed.
title: All round winner

review: The Hotel entrance is nice with good room facilities and Nice beach.  Breakfast is nice, but the open buffet dinner offers nothing special, so avoid it if you can.  There is so many people offering souvenirs and services at the beach which is really annoying.
title: Business trip

review: I was truly impressed with whitesands and it's staff. Given the current climate the staff and management have done an excellent job. The rooms are fantastic; we had a ocean view but having toured the hotel I would be just as happy with a garden view, the majority of which look out over the carp ponds or swimming pools.  We were on a half board meal plan and found both breakfast and dinner to be excellent.  Such was our enjoyment here that we ended up staying another night.  Keep up the good work. If had any criticism it would be that the beach bar could do with an update and that the bar by the pool needs an extra bar attendant. Security: extremely safe, unobtrusive armed guards with dogs. Metal detectors at reception.
title: As good as ever

review: I am tired not because I am bored but due to the varied activities that the hotel offers. A hotel with the longest coast line ever. ...Water sports. ....! Lovely, friendly staff engaged to ensure that you get everything done for you.  The refurbished wing is even better.... totally enjoying my stay here. Thank you sarova whitesands
title: Tired....😃

review: My husband and I stayed at Whitesands right after the peak holiday season ended in January. This was our second stay here -we had previously visited in Oct 2012. We had a lovely time -the weather was not too hot, and even though there was a Coke convention it was not too crowded and we got some much needed relaxation. The rooms are great and very comfortable and the "quiet pool" is where we mostly hung out. It was slightly inconvenient that almost every other pool was unavailable our entire stay there due to cleaning. It seemed that the cleaning process took several days which I am not used to for a pool. Otherwise the most notable thing to mention was the food -I felt like it had really improved since our last stay. There was a wonderful salad bar, and more variety using very
title: relaxing stay

review: We stayed at this resort for 7 days leading up to the Easter weekend. The rooms were well appointed and upgraded and the staff was very welcoming. We had 5 kids in our group and the kids club did a great job of keeping them engaged. Service at times sometimes excruciatingly slow but we did not mind. Management did their best to meet expectations of all but there is definitely room for improvement. Tulia spa was exceptional.
title: Good Stay

review: The Sarova Whitesands is a beautiful resort. The beach, the pools, the food, the views, cant fault any of them. However what does let this hotel down is the service. The staff themselves are lovely and really friendly but it just takes forever to get anything done.   When I booked this hotel, I requested 3 single beds in the room as there were 3 of us sharing. I had emailed the day before we left for Kenya to confirm my requests. We arrived at the hotel at 9am and had to call reception 5 times as well as having to go in person but still no extra bed. Was only when it was midnight and we threatened to leave was another bed brought down.   There were also an issue with the towels. Again only 2 but there were 3 of us. 2 of us showered fine but the 3rd had to wait 45mins with 3
title: A gorgeous resort but...

review: Been coming here for years. But this time. Disappointed. Service poor and attitude of staff appalling.  Very understaffed and when asking for anything done waiters were very snappy. Not the kenyan hospitality we are used to. A Shame.
title: Welcoming and professional beachside haven

review: After a few flight hiccups, it was blissful to arrive at the Whitesands, before we even drove in I was cheered up by the Easter themed sculptures at the very security conscious yet not intrusive guard post. Polite, professional and attentive staff waited on us over the wide range of buffet dinner choices, which even though it was nearly end of service the staff were willing to freshly prepare specific items.   A very comfortable sleep in the spacious ocean view room was followed by a tranquil breakfast overlooking the carp ponds before wandering through the grounds to one of the three pools. It was incredible that even though we knew the hotel had a high level of occupancy that the pool was almost empty providing us a romantic private pool feel and yet still raising our drinks
title: Professional

review: I can't say enough good things about this Hotel. From the quality of staff service to the many Hotel facilities, we were left wanting to stay another 2 weeks!! The Hotel has many restaurants and bars to choose from offering an amazing variety of food and drink. The main dining area varies its option each night from traditional Swahili to Eastern, Indian, Mediterranean  etc. There is separate 24 hour restaurant also available along with an outdoor seafood restaurant which was fantastic With free entertainment every night in Coco's Bar, it is easy to spend the entire stay in the Hotel without ever leaving the grounds. However Whitesands can organise great city tours without any fuss and a visit to Haller Park is a must Located right on the most beautiful beach you could ever
title: Best Holiday In Years!!!!

review: and Whitesands did it again! by far my most favourite place in Kenya. it is simply a paradise worth coming back again, and again and again! we stayed in the rooms overlooking the ocean - priceless! the rooms are spacious and well appointed, with fantastic bathrooms and really comfy beds. Spotless and extremely clean, great housekeeping, which actually spans throughout the property - very clean and tidy throughout. All-day dining offers great selection and food is really yummy! Spa - the best spa ever! having your massage accompanied by the sound of the ocean is simply amazing. The whole spa area is so serene that you get relaxed by just being there and the treatments are fantastic.  All the staff was so helpful and friendly, yet not invasive, purely professional and warm, making
title: A most Marvellous establishment

review: Was there just this week and was fortunate enough to stay in one of the newly renovated rooms near the spa. They're really beautiful, tastefully decorated, spacious, spic and span.  Really fast WiFi too! Food's great. They change it up every day so it never gets boring.  If you like quiet holidays like I do book a room near the spa. Staff are really friendly and eager to make you feel comfortable. Personalised service was a good touch. Only complaints was that there weren't any waiters or pool attendants in sight by the beach.  Overall,  I highly recommend sarova whitesands! Thumbs up to all who made the trip so special especially Geoffrey and Mercy in the restaurant,  Jayne-reservation manager and diligent Mr. Samuel who kept our rooms spotless!
title: Just ok

review: I stayed for 4 days in February. The place is really nice. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Take the room in the first floor if you want a terrace in the beach. The spa is nice the staff are polite and nice. The hotel is very secure. Security officers are everywhere. You don't need to leave the resort. You have everything you need. They are very accommodating to customers needs.
title: Best place in Mombasa

review: Simply the nest in mombasa.the staff are friendly and professional. Clean environment with multiple swimming pools.entertainment on the beach and sporting events.various beach activities. U can chill by the pools or be at the beach by the bar. The Tulia spa is calm a place to re energise. I will always recommend this place.
title: Best experience ever

review: The hotel arranged the airport pick up and I must admit the driver was friendly, knowledgable and very professional. I forgot his name. Upon arriving the staff were very friendly but the check in system was disappointing. We had to wait for not less than 20min to be checked in. We were escorted to our room and introduced to different amenities around. The rooms were very clean and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom though wasn't as clean especially the bathtub was quite dirty. The towel required to be replaced. 4pm tea was awesome. The food at the pavilion was great. Idk why they have to sell drinks even while you paid for all inclusive.  The beach was very welcoming but the beach boys and hawkers seems to disrupt peace. I couldn't let my wife walk alone, they made it so
title: ShiiYerf valentines

review: I was on a business trip and spent three days here. The resort is set in 23 acres of gardens full of coconut palms and other sub tropical plants. The setting is really relaxing. The beach is a fabulous stretch of white sand fringed with palm trees. You will get pestered by Hawkers as soon as you set foot on the beach. Staff at the hotel are friendly and courteous. The rooms are spacious and have all  the facilities you would expect for this class of hotel. My balcony overlooked one of several swimming pools which fitted perfectly into the overall design of the gardens. I ate here in the evening for each of the three nights of my stay. The buffet in the Pavilions restaurant is very good with a good selection of food on offer. On my stay, the hotel was operating on about one third
title: Great Hotel in Superb Location!

review: Spent a night and a day. The rates were quite high- with conformity to the "high" season(of which the place was barely half full). The new renovated rooms look fantastic but are quite small for such rates-one would actually even think they would even have a bathtub for a more leisurely experience. However, I particularly commend the receptionist (Lawrence Otieno and team for their great hospitality and service). He actually offered me a one off discount rate, which I really appreciate-very cool dude.The Bar Supervisor at the swimming pool (Redempta) was also very friendly and ensured that I had a memorable time-free french fries for all heheh! The chicken burger I had was really awesome, probably the best I had in a really long time. The cool music blaring from the swimming pool
title: Lovely stay

review: After staying in Sarova Panafric Nairobi, which has been our traditional destination, we decided to change this time. we headed for the Sarova Whitesands. we stayed for 2 weeks here and the experience was fantastic. Starting with arrival and the room. Since we were repeat client we got Sea front 1st floor. Everything else just came into our good books. Infact now we decided that we will stay here more often than Panafric. The day starts with a bare feet long walk until the north end of the beach to see the turtles laying eggs and returning, then the perfect sunrise followed by open air exercise and completing with heart filling completely healthy breakfast. Sarova Whitesands has perfect location to just walk across the beach and plenty space to stay interior and variety in the
title: Amazing service

review: Greetings,  I had an opportunity to stay here on a business trip. The staff are very helpful and polite. Security is very good and its unfortunate I was on business, the place is asking for indulgence.  International grade hotel and services to match while being competitively priced.  Plan to go back
title: Unique

review: very comfotable hotel,good food,and this guy john yegon really makes u feel comfortable in there.he really made our stay there enjoyable.oooh valentines dinner was organised very well.nd also the staff ther r friendly .4 sure i wil be back there again nd again.
title: valentines day

review: I retreated to this exquisite resort for honeymoon with my gorgeous wife. Everything about it is excellent from the staff, ambiance, reception, meals, comfort. Ms. Yula Kajune the eCommerce assistant was extremely warm and helpful in booking and she was courteous enough to check on us even after we checked in...great great lady in deed. Our flight was delayed by bad weather but we had nothing to worry about because as soon as we informed the hotel, our airport pick up time was rearranged accordingly. All the drivers including; Boyd, Richard and Amani were extremely warm, kind and professional. Angela at the guest relations desk was amazingly warm and friendly. She arranged for us to have breakfast served in bed on an extra day. Yvonne and Mary were just as friendly. Doreen at
title: Awesome, simply awesome

review: A very good beachside resort - friendly staff, clean rooms, good food. Service could have been a shade better but let's be honest, you cannot expect Asian service levels in Africa.  Strong recommendation for all on visit to Montana, be it for business or tourism. Day activities are well organised. Secured by an army of guards.  Please try out the lobsters!
title: Family adventure

review: The entertainment is to die for. The bands, especially the blind people's band (I forget their name but they were all blind) are awesome. The food was kept interesting with themes changing everyday. Sea view rooms are the best, partial view of the pool with a full sea view, great way to wake up. The staff were friendly and the service was top notch. I would say that the only problem is getting a booking as they are often overbooked... if you can get one then you are guaranteed that it will be worth every penny.
title: Awesome

review: Nice place which is not very far from the town and also close to Mamba Village where one can visit the crocodiles. The resort has some beach sports and for those who want to stay awake late at night they can go to the beach Bar that also serves soft drinks.  The set up is inviting but if one stays more than two nights one may miss the daily hustle and bustle of Mombasa including the fast food places like that served at Hashemia which serves excellent chicken and fish barbeque.  Location is excellent provided you take sea facing rooms.
title: Nice place for a holiday.

review: Great for families  and couples as well looking for cosy corners and a late night bar on the beach front.  if you are looking to lay on the beach on sunbeds and work on your tan... i would not recommend this as the tides are sentimental and takeover the beach.  Good location for. water sports.  Friendly staff but with  a lazy pace...don't expect things to happen fast..but hey its Mombassa and not a business hotel!
title: Ahhh..thats a bit of paradise but sadly temperamental white sands...

review: A once-in-a-lifetime trip to Kenya... two nights midweek last month... and what wonderful memories we brought home from White Sands and Mombasa.  The staff really made our stay special... a month later, and we still remember names and faces of those who welcomed us so warmly... Jayne, Rebmann, Newton, Stephen... the gardeners taking care of the coconut palms, who took the time to explain in depth what they were doing, and opened cocoanuts for us to drink... the gardener who sat crosslegged weeding the lawn, who spoke little English, but always had a smile and a cheery "Jambo" for us.  The rooms were wonderful, the beds were comfortable and we slept very well, the shower was a treat, the ground-floor ocean view was beautiful, the camel rides up the beach were fun, the buffets
title: Memorable...
Sarova Whitsands Resort, Mombasa - a good getaway

review: The place is really nice,rooms are spacious and neat,the staff are kind and very proffessional.good outdoor activities.the manager mr herman helped us to organise a surprise birthday with limited time available. Kudos to all the staff....
title: Excellent place....

review: Had a great weekend in the newly refurbished ocean view rooms. Stayed at the hotel from 28-31, May 2015. My room No. 3047 was beautiful with a great lighting and well functioning AC. The room bar was well stocked. My room steward Fredrick Ochieng did a fantastic job ensuring my stay was comfortable. The safari sounds band did not disappoint with their entertainment. I must say the food variety was splendid. The WiFi was slow in the room but overall in other areas of the hotel it was fast. Looking forward to my next visit.
title: Great Weekend

review: Our pick up from the airport was on time, clean car with A/C. We expected check in to be equally swift but to our disappointment, we were made to wait as they looked for a room for us....despite booking weeks in advance! Our sea view room was spacious, but not clean. The floor had sand and we had to call housekeeping for face and hand towels to be provided. Newspapers in the morning is a task to have them delivered. We called the reception twice, and finally had to go ask for them physically because the promise of 'they're being brought' yielded nothing.  The labor day outside dinner was beautiful but let down by the grumpy waitresses. We asked for water and it took over 15 minutes to have it served, the waitress had no apologies and we found this rude. Thanks to Seif who is
title: Great stay

review: Truly a place to go back again and again. The beach front room are perfect, Minazi for kids food is awesome not forgetting the coco's bar.. My Little ones definitely will want to go back again. Swimming Pool games were everyday activity to look forward to.TT also made my afternoons when the little one's slept.. We loved the whole experience.
title: A Let Down!!

review: Overall place a great place to take a break, lots of activities to do, very helpful staff, we took a trip to the marine park organised by the Blue Lagoon which was superb. Their spa is also exceptional and was a great experience
title: a great get away

review: We travelled three of us some time in April this year and had an fabulous time. While checking in we got upgraded to ocean facing rooms which was on a higher floor and that kickstarted our amazing holiday. We never had a dull moment throughout the trip. Spent almost an entire day in one of the many pools they have that had a pool bar with the stools inside the pool. I will always remember the view of the palm trees and the ocean from the balcony when we woke up in the morning. Sweet memories indeed. The rooms were well made and the bed huge and comfortable. The dining experience was excellent as we were on half board hence we got a chance to enjoy breakfast and dinner in their main restaurant. Quite a large buffet selection if i may say. The band playing during dinner time was
title: Sweet memories are made of this!
The ultimate in Swahili luxury and elegance

review: As a frequent traveller for business to Mombasa's north beach coast - my favorite hotel which I have been frequenting for more than 20 years is Sarova's WhiteSands Beach Resort and Spa. Set on Bamburi beach, around 25 minutes drive from Moi International Airport, this hotel has maintained its five star status through meticulous upkeep which means that the traveller will never be disappointed with its elegant high standards and its refreshingly coastal hospitality and service. Whether you stay in a standard room or one of the hotels fabulous two person suites on the top floor, you will experience Swahili luxury embedded in the rooms furnishings as well as in the general style of architecture throughout the complex, accross its many swimming pools and lawns. I am a tough guest to
title: Lovely honeymoon

review: Amazing services, rooms, pools, night life, food and the   The spa is the best .... it's very relaxing   The rooms facing the ocean are the best and it's very clean   The bar is really nice and calm   I've been going to whitesands since I was small
title: One of the best

review: Sarova Whitesands Beach  resorts is a very good place to stay with family n friends facing sea beach is very clean and lots of activities and few good restaurants to visit.Room and ambience is very good.
title: THEY ARRANGE OUR SAFARI TOUR WHICH WAS VERY SATISFACTORY

review: I had a great stay - in a sea front newly renovated room. Very high standards of cleanliness and service. Unlike my last review in 2014 where i complained of damp beds, this time was flawless. The service, from front office, to room service, to gym, to dining was all excellent. Would recommend this.  Whitesands, please maintain the friendly prices for residents!
title: Wonderful place to stay when on Business Trip, or on Vacation

review: Whitesands is a marvelous resort, good conference venues and the hotel is very beautiful from the outside, but they need to upkeep the rooms even more...they should also make sure that the wifi connection is good at every building...however, the pool is splendid and i enjoyed every moment of my stay!!
title: Beautiful Beach Resort!!

review: had a very good buffet dinner with some corporate friends and i have to admit the place is just fabulous ! variety and good entertainment made a positive impact ! Live band invited played one of my favourite taita song " Charonyi ni wasi "!  meaning Journey of challenges in a city ! Will go back there again !
title: Well enjoyed evening out and dinner !

review: Very helpful staff , excellent food, very very clean and I strongly recommend you visit Mombasa they treat tourists like royaltys there is no such thing as fear. So please visit Mombasa .i am writing is review from white sands hotel it is our 4th day today and still have 6 more days to enjoy the luxury. I have come on holidays with my family but at the moment it's only myself and my sister here the rest of the crew are claiming Killi mount,they join us on 20th June 15 . And white sands is the right hotel to come to after all heard and rewarding work they will do.
title: Definitely a 5 star hotel

review: My second stay at the Sarova Whitesands.  I have absolutely no negatives about this hotel. Staff, food, rooms, pools, ambience, are all excellent. The wonderful white, sandy  beach are a few steps away.Keep it up, I will be back.
title: Consistently excellent

review: We made a mid year visit to the resort and had a great time. The staff were cordial and generally we received the level of service we have come to expect from this facility. Our only complaint was mainly in the housekeeping department where our room was left unattended on some days till almost 5pm. We did make our displeasure known to the front desk but other than that most other things were handled well. The entertainment team led by Victor was fabulous!
title: Good Experience

review: The staff, food and rooms were perfection. We had beach facing rooms and were steps away from the soft white sand. The state if the art rooms were absolutely awesome. I highly recommend Sarova white sands
title: Awesome

review: I normally prefer villas whenever i visit mombasa but this time my sister and i thought we should do a hotel...we narrowed our choices to 3 and decided that whichever hotel that has the most positive reviews on trip advisor is the one that we will book...we settled on whitesands(so many positive reviews) ... We were not dissapointed a bit..the driver was on time for our airport pick up/drop off, and very friendly... The staff too was very friendly... Especially Mr.JOHN YEGON who made sure we had a smooth check in...i didn't even spend more than 10min at the reception.. I was impressed! And he was always on call whenever we needed help. Our sea view room was amazing, breathtaking! The dinner themes made us look forward to dinner everynight haha..cocos beach bar, oh my!! It's 2
title: Leap of faith

review: My experience here was not very nice to begin with.. maybe it was due to the fact that the hotel was fully booked.. So I got an old room with two beds and asked to be changed.. this didn't go too well and after raising hell it happened.. by this time I was really pissed. Going for dinner felt like I was back in school fully packed once more.. The bathroom and toilet facilities in the room were small.. not nice.. I hate having to shower in a bathtub. Next morning was much better though.. Staff much nicer.. Guess I'll blame it on the full occupancy for now. Will give it a try some other time see if the experience will be better..
title: Turned out okay

review: Our entire stay was magical...Loved the breakfast, sea food & bar cocktails. The rooms were spacious, extremely clean and our view was totally to die for. Tulia Spa is on it's own level....A must try. Can't wait to go back in August!!!
title: Great Experience!!!Amazing Spa

review: Simply amazing. The food that was served was also extremely delicious and our vegetarian needs were very well catered to. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing stay! Nice to have the beach on your doorstep too, I hope they maintain the high standards.
title: Best experience

review: I trully enjoyed my stay.  excellent food, very very clean and I strongly recommend you visit Mombasa they treat tourists like royaltys there is no such thing as fear.   So please visit Mombasa .i am writing is review from white sands hotel it is our 4th day today and still have 6 more days to enjoy the luxury.
title: Stay.

review: from the main entrance to the reception,security at its best.clean rooms,great customer service,White sands is a five star  hotel for good reasons.overlooking the ocean,serene and relaxing.worth every penny spent. good conference rooms and clean Lido restaurant,the beach bar awesome. book early,prices are high from August to February. 90% international tourists because of efficient service from airport to the hotel.a true paradise in Mombasa.put  it on your to -visit bucket list!!
title: truly a home away from home...

review: This was my second stay at Whitesands, the first one being August 2014. This time we booked the Palm Rooms especially after the recommendation we had heard from staff. Here is a brief review to help others: Check in: They still have airport style security from the moment you drive in the Hotel. The car is thoroughly checked and even in person as you enter - this is no issue as shows the safety element that the hotel takes which is worth the extra checks. We called the day before and were told as long as we would get to the hotel by 11AM, we would be good to check in. Sadly when we reached at 11AM, we were told the rooms were not ready. The annoying bit was staff kept telling us to wait for 10 mins when in actual fact we got our first room at 12:30. This was past the check in
title: Palm Rooms are a must over Standard Rooms!!

review: "Fabulous"  Our airport pick up/ drop off  was right on time and we (My son and I) were greeted with cold bottles of water and fruit. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the service(s) was great. They have a good number of pools which are clean and well kept. Their members of staff are great👍 everything in our rooms worked perfectly. (except for the safe which was locked and was never unlocked till the day we left). Room 3122.  The dinning room staff were very helpful. I had dietary problems and they handled it exceptionally well.. The food was fantastic with lots of different cuisines. A very big thank you to all their staff and keep up the good work. Beach boys were a nuisance. Yes I would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. I would go back again.
title: Excellent Service, Good Food, Nice Rooms

review: I only stayed in the hotel for just over ten hours but it was a very enjoyable stay. I arrived late after 9pm. I had half board so thought I will have missed dinner. Not at all I was escorted to the al a carte resturant and had and excellent Ceasers salad followed by an equally excellent spaghetti carbonara. As I would be leaving very early I though I would miss breakfast, again what a surprise they have a short breakfast from 3 am which was more than sufficient. The hotel is very well maintained in very nice grounds. The room was very well appointed with nice bathroom and a very comfortable bed. Staff very efficient and welcoming.
title: Splendid

review: Our airport pick up was right on time and we were greeted with cold bottles of water. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the services are great. They have a good number of pools which are clean and well kept. Their members of staff are great👍 everything in our rooms worked perfectly. The beach is a big plus. I would definitely go back again and will definitely recommend to anyone. I had a very pleasant stay (I did not want to leave).
title: Great plance to enjoy Mombasa

review: Awesome hotel on the north coast in mombasa. Beautiful, clean and safe. All five pools were clean at all times. Food was good. They had a variety of food choice for breakfast and dinner. A wide selection to choose from. All workers were very courteous and very professional.
title: Vacation

review: We stayed in the Palm room and the view was fantastic, they have been refurbished and are very warm and the look very beautiful and clean and with modern facilities. It was not sea front but the view of the lovely swimming pool and well manicured gardens was so breath taking. The hotel has a variety of places that one can just sit and relax. The beach is very nice too. Most of the staff are very warm and welcoming. Very near the shopping malls too and variety of transportation right outside the hotel. They provide for child care too for guests with children and they have a variety of entertainment for the kids too. The food was fresh but not always tasty.
title: Short, sweet and precise

review: I just love this place. I come here all the time am at the Coast. Very friendly staff that conduct themselves in a professional manner, got a room upgrade and I couldn't have asked for more. Food is plenty and a wide variety. They had a selection of food accommodating different cultures; Coastal, Continental, Indian..  I was awake at 2am and to my surprise the guards outside the room were fully awake and offered their assistance. I felt safe and quite happy. Salsa night right? Fun!! Fun! Fun! The band also creates a great atmosphere and you are the people that make me look forward to coming to Mombasa!! I'll definitely recommend this hotel to everyone; friends, family, couple, business.. you'll love it!
title: Perfect!

review: This is a large spacious, gracious Beach Hotel.  On our first day the hotel was hosting almost 5 separate corporate conferences.  It was loud, messy and we were wondering how we would last the duration of our stay. The magic, the next day all the conference delegates were gone and the hotel recovered to a very pleasing and charming beach Front resort. A Fun kiddie pool, a second lazy pool and a third zen quiet pool.  A Great beach with may water sport opportunities.  a Special thanks to Jayne who took great care of us, and to Mary in the kids club who made my little daughters stay really memorable.
title: Great Beach Hotel

review: This is one hotel where you will be able to interact with managers and share your experiences - whether it is the General Manager, The Finance director, F& B manager, etc.  Why is this important? I can share my joys and disappointments and get immediate action where correction is required. Personal attention leaves one feeling awesome.  Beds are key for me. Awesome beds and I slept like a baby every night.  Bottle of wine on arrival in my room, as a compliment from the hotel, made me totally happy
title: Approachable mangers at whatever level

review: The experience was worthwhile and excellent.  fell in love with the beach and breathtaking views from my hotel room.  i also enjoyed the coastal foods,  plenty of fun activities to carry out that we couldn't get the chance to do them all. The rates were quite good and affordable
title: Excellent stay

review: We visited whitesands last week for 2nights. & our stay was the most relaxing!  Although it does usually gets packed as it is renowned to hold major local conferences.  Our check in wasn't as smooth as we expected as the hotel was packed to 100% capacity. However the staff more then made up for the delay. Rooms were amazing and we were upgraded to sea/ocean view rooms.  Travellers should insight on getting the refurbished rooms as other rooms are old and need upgrades. The spa was equally refreshing and amazing.  Overall the staff are extremely friendly and we got great service from the crew. Thanks. Wished we had stayed for a week!!!! :)
title: Awesome Place!

review: The compound had great scenery, ocean view was breath taking, the food was awesome hotel staff were so customer friendly. I cant wait to be back to this facility. The facilities are perfect for both a private function like honey moon and a business meeting
title: Beauty of Sarova Whitesands Bamburi

review: My group of friends and family had a great time and really enjoyed the facility. My kids loved the place. We all enjoyed the evenings with dinner served in the garden areas. The hotel offered Pre-teens activities which the kids between 12-15yrs enjoyed.
title: Fanatastic rooms especially the Seaview room and very good food! Good holiday.

review: The food was superb, rooms very clean, laundry services very good and the rooms well  maintained and the beach very clean. The staff were also very helpful and polite. A second visit is mandatory for me before year end.
title: Excellent

review: I think this is true of all hotels in Mombasa, I've visited every year since I was born but things seemed to change for the worse a few years ago and it's just not the same buzzing place it used to be. The facilities are okay, not run down or anything unlike others. Service could definitely be improved. A water pipe burst the day we were leaving and we'd just been to the beach so needed to shower - to compensate for the lack of water we were given one bucket of hot water to share between 3 people... Food selection was poor and very repetitive. The hotel was also hired out for some sort of conference so meal times would be very busy but you would hardly see anyone the rest of the day.
title: Dull

review: I don't typically like resorts. But for one night this place was great--the grounds are beautiful, nice bar right on the beach, lots of chairs for lounging, and the buffet for dinner and breakfast is extensive.
title: Big resort with beautiful grounds and good service

review: We had 2 nights stay here and liked it a lot. The restaurant is very good and the staff is cordial. We loved the pool area. The rooms are very good and are well decorated. The spa too is excellent. We enjoyed our stay.
title: Very good hotel on the beach

review: My family and I are here for a hopefully quiet holiday. We are up at 2am at night and have been unable to sleep the whole night as there has been  a live concert "private event"  right outside our room the whole night!!! Our efforts to ask the front desk to move to another room because  we have children etc are fruitless and met with "sorry". We have stayed here before  but I am totally disappointed  by the lack of consideration for us as guests!!
title: Dissatisfied customer

review: Even though this is my fifth visit (in both private and business capacity) I still get extremely annoyed by the absolute lack of professionalism exhibited by the staff and management.  Compared to the other hotels/resorts in the vicinity the Sarova Whitesands Beach Resort is nice, the rooms have recently been upgraded and the quality of the food is decent, yet when compared to the international standards they proclaim to uphold and compete with, they are far off.  - the high number of security guards at the hotel is a nuisance as well as well as a disturbance as they (both male and female security) seem fascinated by the half naked tourist reclining on the premises. - the waiters (there are many) are too busy chatting with each other than paying attention to the guests. - after
title: Overstaffed - Underserviced minimum security prison

review: Stayed at this Hotel yet again because i knew what to expect and was hoping i was not going to be disappointed........i was not.The Hotel has very good customer service inculcated on Staff right from the top to the groundsman and one is made to feel welcome as soon as you arrive there.They have recently introduced complimentary fresh juice and water near the Reception area which helps during hot weather.I was accompanied by a minor for a much-needed rest/business trip and the Kids Club,ably led by Ms Mary have always done a very good job of keeping the lad busy,so much so that he would rather spend all his days there !That works for me especially when i have to combine business with leisure and this is one of the reasons i keep going back.........Their refurbished rooms are
title: ''Relaxing.......''

review: "Wonderful experience" Excellent customer service, we went there for our honeymoon and we will definitely bring our children in the future.Excellent amenities! A very safe beach location ! Great food ! On the downside the taxi service is extremely pricey compared to the local rates so we would recommend taking a matatu or a tuk tuk !
title: Blissfull relaxation

review: Various clean swimmingpools to choose from. Very child friendly with kiddies pools and slide. Enough pool chairs for all guests. Excellent beach towel service. Good service at pool and beach bar. Drinks are very affordable. Beautifull clean white sandy beach. Only problem when taking a stroll on the beach are all the hawkers trying to sell you things. One can snorkel close to the beach but the marine life is not spactacular.  Rooms are serviced quite late in the day, usually only in the afternoon. Staff are very helpfull and friendly. Loved the free wi-fi to keep n touch with relatives. Excellent spa at very affordable rates.
title: Terrible experience

review: We booked the 18 rooms in this hotel for 4 nights but had the worst service experience in this hotel. Hotel operation manager Jane and Raj we deal with and like to say they don’t care about customer at all. We got 12 renovated room and 6 old room which is not renovated. The old room are very dirty and not even hygienic see the pics, the bathroom walls, Tub and sink has lot of mold stain and had very bad smell in room. When I showed the pic to Jane operation manager and request her to change our rooms she said she will try to clean the room but even after cleaning the whole room they are not able to remove the stain. We request her to change our room she said she don’t have any availability which was completely false because we got the renovated room same night after we reach out
title: Worst experience

review: Parking - Available Valet Service - Wanting Ambiance - Engrossing Food - Sumptuous but dear Drinks - Impressive variety Music - Classic Access to the Beach - Fantastic Indoor Swimming Pool - Residents Only Overall - Excellent
title: Britam's Broker Cocktail

review: I would not consider staying anywhere else. The staff really make your stay. So well trained and attentive. Bernard on reception, Angela guest relations and Martha, hostess in Pavillions restaurant are an example of excellent customer service. From the housekeepers to the bell boys, they make your stay enjoyable. Very nice rooms. If there are any problems they address them straight away and will do their best to fix them asap. I will keep coming back
title: Simply the best

review: Got room number 3092 in the upper floors  in my two visits with my daughter and she loved the place. The kids club activities, the water slide and general ambience......then the food was amazing. My daughter loved the place.
title: Lovely place.

review: Sada, Latifah and I spent a spending 10 days' vacation at Sarova this September and we got more than we bargained for. The Spa is serene, staff are terribly kin and the service divine. A kid's heaven!
title: A wonderful bit of heaven; Sarova!

review: We are currently staying just under a week at Sarova Whitesands in Mombasa. We have stayed here each time we have visited Mombasa and it never disappoints.   Staff are superb, service is great and is always with a smile, the chefs made some lovely vegetarian food as per our group's dietary requirements, pizzeria restaurant food was fab, fun activities to do such as beach volleyball and zumba, and spa massages are excellent. Rooms we stayed in are great, and so lovely to have the choice of so many swimming pools!  The hotel is lovely but it is always the service which determines how good a stay will be. Whilst there were some small hiccups, the staff here ensured to rectify these immediately.  Service here is fantastic. There are so many staff which have made our stay perfect -
title: Fantastic holiday

review: This is my third time to be in this hotel during the festive seasons...and year by year...it gets better and better...i would like to use this platform to thank 3 people who made it all worth it...firstly I would like to thank ARAFA KENJI for all her service throughout the years...I would like to thank ROSELYN SIMIYU for her energetic services... She and her team made sure our rooms where up to date...lastly i would like to give a big thank you to RAVI GABRIAH for his ever ready services...as vegetarians he made sure we had amazing food...a big thumbs up to all staff...they worked so hard...one small disappointment was the front office department..it needs improvement..it's very slow and no positive help when one is billed the wrong bills...the staff in that department doesn't
title: All worth it

review: I believe this so far is the best place I visited during my time in Mombasa..the food is sumptuous well presented and served..pools is super clean and huge to accomodate many...the waiters and general staff have excellent PR ..would reccommend it a gazillion times
title: Great for business travel, excellent for family holidays

review: The best place to spend in Mombasa.Good experience,amazing views,caring staff..The beach is also really nice.I loved the wifi,food and outdoor activities especially for the kids. I am definately coming back soon..
title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE

review: I've previously travelled to Sarova Whitesands on business, and enjoyed every bit of it, but it was the recent family holiday that made me decide to write this review.   First, the customer service was 5*, from the reception to the room service, pool service and the children activities. Secondly, we got a strategically located spacious, clean, sea facing family room, which we all loved...and would request for the same in the future. Thirdly, the pools were very clean. Although the hotel is very big, and was almost full during our stay, we never felt overcrowded, as is the case in many other settings during the festive season. Fourthly, Tulia, the sea facing spa was great...the ambience and the service quality were unmatched. Fifthly, and the main reason why we'll be going back
title: Worthwhile experience

review: Quality of service has really dropped. Staff are ever overwhelmed, seems they have cut down on staff.  Our booking was messed up, rooms were to be allocated latest by noon we didn't get any till 4pm.  Pool side and bar had practically only one person serving, though they show of on having 24hr restaurant & bar open there is nothing of that sort.  Food variety for 5 days we stayed was practically the same daily which was not the case with White Sands this must have been our 10th / 12th time there but next time definitely we need to think twice.  What kept us going was we were a group of 25 ppl, hence the enjoyment.
title: Got to think twice when booking again at White Sands

review: Very nice hotel for Mombasa. The beach views are amazing and the staff is very courteous and friendly. Food buffet is good, but just about the same items every night with a little variety. This hotel caters to the resort/wedding crowd. If you're looking for a long term place to stay, they have just normal smaller rooms available. Good value for the price, and the pools are nice. I can imagine if you have kids this would be a nice place for you to stay for 4-5 days.
title: Nice resort hotel

review: This was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, the staff were very caring, there was loads to do, we met lots of other English/Dutch people which I didn't think we would do. We caught a barracuda on a fishing trip and the kitchen staff were nice enough to prepare it for our meal that evening. Amazing place, amazing holiday.
title: Lovely place, would love to go back

review: It is a beautiful Resort on the beach. Very bug area, spa, health club, so many modern facilities are there. Services are good. Staffs are friendly. Varieties of foods available. Fresh fishes, Prawns, Crabs are there.  Taste are fantastic. We like it.
title: Beautiful Resort on the Beach

review: Whitesands was the hotel we first visited when we started our honeymoon. The hotel staff was very helpful and had pleasant encounters with the dining, reception and housekeeping staff. The rooms were amazing and with great facilities for use. We enjoyed our meals and it was good to have a band playing as we took our dinner. We were quite at ease being at the beach front as we were not disturbed by beach boys or sellers. I recommend the hotel for business stays.
title: Lovely Hotel

review: As a member of the Board of ISACA Kenya Chapter, we held a Cybersecurity and Data Governance Conference at the Hotel from 29th - 31st July 2015 (attended by about 150 participants). The hotel has good conferencing facilities, nicely renovated & comfortable accommodation rooms, good food, courteous staff, 'softened' tap water, and nice sandy beach on the shore of Indian Ocean (Mombasa, Kenya).  I certainly recommend the Joel for conference activities and holidaying.
title: A Nice Hotel in Deed!

review: The WHITESANDS beach resort has a long and lovely beachfront, with breathtaking views from the sea-facing rooms. This is a very big Hotel of over 400 rooms and although there were many conferences going on during our stay, the hotel staff  and food were all first rate and could not have been much better, Mealtimes got very busy BUT we had peace and quiet for most of the day and evenings around the coconut infringed gardens, white sandy beach, swimming pool, gym,etc  Our room, 1047, was modern, clean and comfortable. We could walk from our balcony straight onto the green, well-manicured lawns which are infringed with coconut palms or just go and sit on the water’s edge.   The WiFi around the gardens and inside the rooms was problematic but in our room there was a docking station
title: LOVELY BEACH RESORT

review: Amazing hotel! Great staff! The rooms big and very comfortable beds!  The sea facing rooms are beautiful! There was a great variety of food as well! Definitely coming back! Asante Sarova! Always enjoyed the Sarova hospitality :)
title: Good Experience!

review: My stay at the whitesands was excellent. Right from the hotel pick up to the stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful, no racism at all and the hotel facilities are exquisite. This is a place i can return over and over again.
title: Great Stay at Whitesands

review: Its been months but still have memories our previous stay Being a Frequent traveller and having stayed at this hotel for the 3rd time, I must say am amazed by the level of hospitality in this hotel in particular  the entire staff line from the reception through to the Security have always displayed a higher level of hospitality which doesn't exist in many hotels around  Special thanks to Lawrence and his team at the Reception who nothing was a hustle to them, Humphrey who always made our evening cocktails to remember, Katumbo, from restaurant, Bongo from house keeping who made sure that our room was sparkling clean too bad can't remember all names of the Guest Relation Ladies who made sure i get the best flowers for my fiancee by the way she still remembers them till to date
title: Where Hospitality Lives

review: My group and I checked in after a tiring day and a long wait at the airport. The staff quickly restored our smiles with their quick wit and friendly smiles. Apologies to all cat lovers in advance, but this was my only downer for the trip. Cats freak me out and they were present at the restaurant. Thanks again to the staff for taking them out so I could eat without shrieking :).  I was woken by monkeys tapping on the glass outside and birds chirping in the trees while the waves lapped at the shore right outside my balcony... Bliss!!! I was really in the coast!   I loved the food and the excellent band that played at the main restaurant.
title: A wonderful 2 days rest after safari

review: After a wonderful safari and a mad drive from Nairobi, we couldn't have asked for a better place to relax. The hotel is large but still feels relaxed and the design is excellent. The staff were very friendly and attentive. They gave us a surprise birthday cake from my boyfriend which was delicious! Always my first pit stop before heading elsewhere on the coast. A good place to be if you want to visit Mombasa town and Fort Jesus.
title: Impressive facility

review: I have been here for the past few days and the stay so far has been enjoyable. The entertainers (water aerobics etc) are fun and keep the whole group integrated. Definately worth a visit. The beaches are public however no issues apart from them wanting to make a sale. The hotel is also close to nice bars such as Tapas
title: UK

review: We booked the resort for 2 days through their official website. To our surprise, we got to know that the hotel is available at almost 50% rates on 3rd party tour operators like bonfire!! Even in reporting to their office on the difference, the hotel staff did little to ease our frustration of paying 100% over other guests. They have a don't care attitude and customer experience seems to be last on their priority. Very bad experience!!
title: Over charging.. And no good customer complaint handling

review: When I arrived I did expect more from my check - in experience. My check - in was done without explaining to me I was on full board. I had to ask what package my agent booked me on. No one showed me to my room. A very big resort so spotted a gentleman on the walk way. He explained where to go but would have liked to be taken to my room. No activities were even explained to me or what was on offer.  I was very pleasantly surprised in the size and decor of the rooms. Nice new bathroom.  Lovely clean rooms.  Food very average.  If you like a huge property with lots of people then this the property for you.
title: Average Stay

review: Great hospitality right from reception by a gentleman named Yegon. He ensured that we were comfortable with the rooms we got especially because it was a family holiday. Spacious rooms for a family of four with a sea/beach view. Amazing food with a great variety. Very hospitable staff especially at the restaurant. At one point the baby had wondered away from our table and the speed at which every restaurant staff stopped what they were doing to look for him was amazing. The swimming pool is large and lots of fun. I will stay here again for sure.
title: Totally Enjoyed the Stay

review: Our stay at Sarova whitesands was welcoming. Right from the moment we arrived till we left after our 2 nights stay. Tulia Spa was beautiful and the food was lovely too. Special thanks to Judy (the sales account manager) who took her time with us throughout our stay. She was on hand to provide answers to all our questions as we had a brief tour around the property.
title: Warm Hospitality

review: I stayed here for a week with two teenage boys, and we all had a ball. They loved the activities, all of the swimming pools, and the buffet was excellent every night. We only had breakfast and dinner included in our package, but the lunches were very affordable. I would say that the spirit drinks were more expensive than other places we have stayed in Kenya, but generally the hotel was good value for the standard. I can see why people find the beach boys irritating, but you can also avoid their approaches by being polite but direct. When the sea goes out it is not very swimable in the sea, but there are at least 4 swimming pools at the hotel, so we didn't miss it.
title: Favourite for our family

review: Another return visit with lots of exciting activities and entertainment. Appropriate for family especially the kids. Now management is able to accommodate different guests including politicians and ensures no group inconveniences others. The fish pools and gardens were given a facelift. Great
title: The kids never want to try any other facility

review: The level has dropped on this wonderful property - beautiful grounds but use not upto par - it's confrence land not efficient anymore has lost the beauty. rooms are upgraded can do for a quick stay defenitely not a hotel to stay on in..
title: Quick stop over

review: The rooms are very very nice. The upgrades done are really nice and up to date. Service is very good. There are different cuisines available. The spa services are also really good. I enjoyed my stay and hope to be back soon.
title: A Pleasant Stay

review: I stayed at the Sarova Whitesand Beach Resort & Spa with my family in Aug 2015. We were all impressed with the quality of services on offer from airport transfer to hotel facilities. There was plentiful of good food. We managed to get the good quality of rested that we were looking for. I would defiantly go again.
title: A very good hotel with plenty of fantastic food

review: From the moment we arrived we were looked after by staff who are highly trained, friendly, interested in our welfare and made our stay the best Kenyan hotel experience we have had.  We were recommended by a friend to use this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending to others, thank you to all the staff, we hope to return next year
title: This is the best place to stay in Mombasa, Wonderful Whitesands

review: From the moment we arrived we were greeted with warm smiles from the guards to he front office, Stephen has a very infectious smile.To our surprise we were upgraded to a lovely executive room which was nice an cool with a wonderful sea view and a large balcony.  The GM - Raj made a special effort in ensuring that our check in was smooth - and he does that with all his guests, and he has sharp eye for fine details. Excellent food under the supervision of Chef Gurpreet.  A visit to the Tulia spa is a must !! Came out from there totally relaxed.- Thank you Grace
title: Relaxing break

review: I have been going to this beach for ten consecutive years I have tried other beaches in between but I always come back for a week  You want to feel like you Owen a place , this is it . Yes the beach and service had gone down a bit but if is still the best in the area .budget price good food and you can fulfill your imagination. Try it you will not be disappointed Dr Mekonnen Bekeke
title: A change

review: I was at the Sarova Whitesands for a three day conference.  From the entrance of the hotel you get a feeling that this is a grand place and definitely a place to get away for a break.  The check in was quite pleasant. The front desk was very warm. I had made a reservation and the front desk staff were open to me having a look at the allocated room before checking in.  I had a room that has a view of the pool. The room was spacious enough. Large windows that let in lots of natural light and made it feel airy. The room was very clean with a large comfortable bed. The bathroom was very clean and well maintained. The shower had enough pressure.  The restaurant had a good selection of food at breakfast, lunch as well as dinner. The food is fresh. The service at the restaurant was
title: Splendid

review: Transfers from the airport were included in the hotel package which was very useful. Leonard was our driver and was wonderful. As he drove us through Mombasa town to Nyali Bridge towards Bamburi Beach, we had an urgent requirement for a "health" break. Leonard obliged and drove into a petrol station which had facilities. On arriving at the hotel, I understand it was fully booked for the first time in several years [due to terrorist threats and the poor publicity Kenya suffered] and the staff seemed a bit overwhelmed. The receptionist, Alison, booked us into a brilliant room 5047 this was a newly refurbished sea facing room. Thank you Alison.  At 4pm we went for afternoon tea. There was tea, Masala tea, coffee and sandwiches. There were slices of various cakes which were
title: Brilliant three day stay were very spoilt all round - felt very special

review: Had an amazing stay at sarova. The staff is very friendly. They Had a beach bar which was open till late and you could just relax and have your drink. Rooms are also excellent. Very clean and they have 4 pools. Very family oriented.
title: North coast mombasa trip

review: We booked the whitesands as part of a 3 day air/hotel package from Nairobi which was very good value and the airport transport was divine with a very good driver. The check in staff looked harassed and did not smile and were not welcoming but other than that all the staff in the restaurants, rooms and other areas were very friendly. we got a room in the old wing with no sea view. the room was large and comfortable enough but the bathrooms need a facelift though functional. the breakfast and lunch were quite good with a large choice. the gym was average. lots of pools and overall a decent hotel
title: A Weeks Stay

review: I Attended a training session that lasted a week.  My room was over looking the beach hence I could always the sun rise and beach waves as they hit the shallow end.  There were other meetings and the main dining hall was always full for lunch. The service was always good and no delays. Thumbs up
title: Very nice

review: I stayed at this place for a week in November 2015; the standard room i received is not near anywhere to a three start, and have stayed in better rooms in many places in Kenya and Africa. Leaking sin, stained tiles everywhere. And their workers occasionally forget to stock on essentials like towels and shower gels. Oh, and by the way, once you are done, they say thanks, but no thank. On the Friday i was checking out, they didn't allow the cab to pick me inside the hotel compound, and had to drag my suitcase to the road. I don't think i can use my hard earned money for such experience, ever again.
title: Rooms not worth your money, but food okay

review: My boyfriend and I went for 2 days and a night and extended our stay to 4 days. Upon arrival we went snorkelling which was absolutely lovely. The food was great, there is teas served freely everyday in case you get hungry. There are lots of activities such as water polo, dancing classes. The rooms were cleaned spotlessly no matter what time we left the room. The wifi was good. The staff were very friendly. Absolutely no complaints from us. Maybe not a luxurious 5 star but definitely 5 star in terms of food, location, cleanliness and entertainment. Actually one little hiccup, at checkout they forgot we had paid a deposit and almost double charged us. I think it was a mistake on the part of the receptionist but just be careful.
title: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay

review: While visiting friends in Mombasa we visited Whitesands. We had stayed there many times and thought we would spend a day there. One of the first things we did was get a drink and I asked the staff member where my favourite residents were. The cats...  After making enquiries I was informed that they were being disposed of. Some captured and sent to a cats home in a small compound with numerous other unwanted cats. Every hotel keeps cats to keep the rodents under control. An English lady used to go daily to feed them but I was informed she has been banned from doing this.  I can't believe the inhumanity of this. There weren't many there and all of the guests I spoke to were saddened. I would love to hear from the Manager as to his reasons. Mr Hersi the previous manager had no
title: Disappointed

review: Dear Mr Raj Jadhav   I'm sure you remember me Desai family , checked in on the 21st Nov 2015   You call your hotel 5 star are you sure ????    Your attitude is 2nd class your staff attitude is pathetic   Mr Raj this is not my first time I'm staying in a hotel this is not my first time I'm staying in whites sands 3 times my husband more than 4 times , we are well travelled out of the country N within nbi we've been all 5 star hotels N this is the worst every treatment  1) left nbi 4 am with 6 kids all under age of 12 , due to traffic jam of mombasa we arrived late 4 pm - 12 hours on the road , upon Check in we were told no rooms they've been cancelled,  who cancelled definitely not us , upto 5.30 it's still being resolved. All kids cranky tired and hungry no1 welcomed us with any
title: Disappointing experience

review: Overall we had a really nice stay at Whitesands: the location is fantastic. It's literally on the beach, ideal for relaxing under palm trees with a great view over the ocean or besides one of the many pools. The Tulia Spa is also worth a visit and is run professionally.  The food (dinner) was very good but the service personnel, in general, was not really up to standard: faced with simple requests, they were quickly out of their depth and, besides a few exception, were rather slow. This is especially true with regard to the reception desk where slowness meets incompetence: plan for plenty of time to check in and out and, even if you see 10 members of staff and only 2 guests, do not assume that your request will be dealt with quickly or, indeed, efficiently. They also use their
title: Mostly great

review: We arrived at noon which is standard check in at White Sands. They could not find a room for either us nor 3 other families and couldn't be bothered 2 hours later ! Absolutely huge waste of money , I would never ever come here again, absolutely worst service yet they charge premium rates. We had to give over 4 people the same information over and over, manager was overwhelmed and completely unable to provide any solution to anyone.
title: Fantastic

review: Attended an international meeting I was also coordinating logistics. As always The hotel never disappoints. Professional staff and very helpful management helping out in every aspect of the conferencing. Good food, great service and a relaxing atmosphere what more could you ask for.  Special thanks to Jane the Rooms manager and Raj the GM, you exceeded my expectations.  Highly recommended for both business and pleasure.  Looking forward to my next visit.
title: Great holiday spot!

review: I have stayed at the Sarova Whitesands during both business and holiday trips.  My first visit to the hotel, which was during a business trip was good, prompting me to go back again, this time with my family.  We were received by warm and hospitable staff.  My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the staff went out of their way to make our day special and memorable.  It is evident that the hotel has planned that their guests will be comfortable and that they will have a memorable holiday.  They have a variety of pools, including two shallow pools for the kids and a water slide.  In addition, the Ozone kids club is superb and has a variety of activities for the children.  The rooms (sea view facing) are tastefully furnished and comfortable. Free wifi is
title: Not value for money

review: Classy rooms by the sea front, good food, good service! I loved every minute I spent at the hotel. The customer service is just amazing! I particularly want to thank the Ozone Kids club headed by a lady by the name Mary.... she's a star! My children loved her, she is absolutely an amazing lady. Will definitely plan to come again....room 1038 was spectacular!!
title: Excellence at its best!!

review: though I was basicallly in Mombasa for business; I took time to try and do as much sight seeing as I could. The hotel has excellent and friendly service> the food is great and caters to everyone's health needs. Its a good place fo family holiday. The hotl offers transpor to and from the airport. I enjoyed my stay
title: amazing experience

review: I cannot tell you enough about this hotel. It far exceeded our expectations in every way. My wife, kids and i traveled for leisure, and had a fantastic time.  It started off with a little bit of a hiccup, and we ended up being put in rooms in the un-renovated section. We protested and were given rooms in the newly renovated section overlooking the sea. The staff were genuinely friendly and hospitable. The breakfast and dinner buffet offered a great deal of variety and were themed differently every evening. The quality of the food was exceptional. the rooms clean. Service prompt... I could go on and on.  Although the Hotel was on the beach, however, the beach was public. Security was there to make sure non guests could not enter the hotel premises. Anyways, the fact that the
title: Love it, Love it, Love it

review: if i don't go to Whitesands once every few months, I am getting depressed! absolutely the best place to chill out and recharge the batteries. Love the lavish and impeccably kept grounds. staff is ever so friendly and courteous and selection of eating options would leave even the most demanding ones satisfied. A visit to Tulia Spa for a massage is always a must, one of the nicest spas I've been to. Mr Raj, compliments to you and the team for excellent job and I will see you very soon again!
title: Never again :(

review: ... that has to be the objective. So much to do to fill weeks with vacation joy and sustainibly sparkling kids eyes.  I found the Place magnificent and I want to thank the staff for making my brief stay so comfortable.  Kenya: you're cool!!
title: ... to come with family next time...

review: Stopped at Whitesands at the start and end of Safari Rally November 2015. The pictures on website and brochures will show it as a superb place to relax, dine, take in the pools and have fun on the beach!! The restaurants are a lovely place to eat with a huge selection of fresh cooked food - no problem. The pizzeria is a lovely place for lunch - no problem. The waiters and waitresses will bring you drinks you haven't ordered and usually double measures, that as a European visitor they you will pay for with no fuss. Beware!! They obviously have been told to do this!! They will add extra drinks to your bill and pocket the difference - witnessed by a few of us present!! Coco's Beach Bar is surrounded on all sides in the evening by the local "hookers" - hoping to hang on to the
title: Whitesands Hotel Is Not The Place To Relax

review: Went with my elderly mum for 4 nights, half board.  Excellent service, good food and restful stay.  They listened to my requests in terms of my mums needs and catered for every need e.g. ground floor, not far from restaurant, special dietary needs (vegetarian, indian, etc.  Great welcome to my mum every time we went into the restaurant.  Overall mum had a great stay. Thank you.
title: Very disappointing

review: Arrived after long journey, checked in, waited for 10 minutes for someone to come show me the room. This was a security guard who showed me the room. As I was rummaging my bag for a tip he all but practically begged for it which was quite awkward. There were no slippers in the room, it took another 20 minutes and 2 phone calls for them to be delivered. Went for a late dinner, buffet. There were 3 cats around my table, the poor waitress kept trying to chase them away after I informed her I am allergic to cats. Went to pick a plate and came back to find the cats on the table eating my food. The room was poorly cleaned, I found several used matches, quite painful when you're half asleep walking to the bathroom. The only saving grace in my opinion was the dinner on my second night.
title: Going back in 2016!

review: I visited Whitesands twice during my time in Mombasa and have to say i wasn't impressed. The cleanliness at the pools was not good and the service very slow with extra drinks added to the bill. The apartments/rooms round the pool areas looked old fashioned from the outside whereas the entrance into the hotel was quite modern and nicely laid out. The food by the pool was okay.
title: Not great

review: On arrival Stephen gave us a nice room....beautiful hotel and grounds only let down was the level of service in the main resteraunt...no napkins no spoons half an hour to get a drink not acceptable........Christine was very helpful for breakfast the food was very good ...one day we had lunch by the pool but found out later you cannot swap for dinner which is crazy having come from Serena and leopard beach they have a lot to learn about customer service
title: nice hotel

review: This is a great resort for the family vacation and a secure place for a business stay. Situated directly on the beach and with opulent swimming pools everything is provided for. People are friendly and reasonably service minded. Food is fine.  The wifi is there but does not work.
title: Nice resort

review: We stayed here twice on our visit to Kenya: 2 nights in September and we had to come back because we had such a great experience and stayed 2 more nights in October before we departed for Chicago. We had a very relaxing time. Our first room had the pool view. It was on the 3rd floor and we could see the ocean too. The pool at Whitesands snakes through the property. It is almost a half a mile long with different sections. There is even a baby pool that my 15 month-old son could walk around. The wifi was excellent even in our pool view room even though we were quite a ways from the reception area. And when we returned for 2 nights in October, they put us in a room with breathtaking views of the ocean. The food was amazing with dozens of varieties of main course at every meal.
title: Great beach, Gorgeous winding swimming pool, ocean views
Stunning Place, but something is missing to be perfect...

review: this is the 4th visit to the hotel and I am sad to say that despite its prime location and brand pull, it is a former shadow of itself. the renovated rooms are great and the cuisine is alright. my concern is in the level of service especially at check in where a major setback happened where our rooms were not ready until 6 in the evening and our luggage sat in the hallway for over 4 hours as we had to go into town for a meeting. Room for improvement here.
title: less than average experience

review: If you are looking for a family friendly environment then Sarova whitesands is the ideal vacation location for you. We spent three nights in the sea front rooms (#1046/1047). The rooms have a beautiful view of the Indian Ocean and offer easy access to the beach.   We enjoyed the meals and the variety of drinks on offer. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to make our stay memorable. Two waiters stood out for us. Nick in the main restaurant and Peter who served us drinks as we relaxed on the day beds. Their services were exceptional!   Though the hotel had many guests during our stay, we could hardly notice the numbers due to the expanse of the hotel. The hotel is well laid out that with 5 swimming pools in designated areas. For some solitude and silence, then rooms
title: Family friendly environment

review: I spend many of my business trips to Mombasa in this splendid hotel. I also spent my Dec holidays 2014 there. Everything from standard to see facing rooms perfect. There something you get in the standard you dont get in sea facing and vice versa is true. Each is perfect. Tranquility, quality of service and the employees just love their jobs. The beach bar is really good. I missed tou this holidays. I tried somewhere else and I feel like I cheated on you with a less beautiful girl. I had a specific complain which management promised to address. Felt was not being attended promptly at the bar as compared to other guests of other descent. Hope this was fully addressed and next time I come I woudnt face the same. You definately earn your stars.
title: Not soo bad

review: I had mixed  feelings about this hotel before checkin after reading recent reviews and i hope they read them too.  Either their booking system is outdated or their staff are incompetent.
